item.title: U.K. Schools Are Removing Analogue Clocks From Exam Rooms Because Kids Can't Read Them
item.description: U.K. Schools Are Removing Analog Clocks Because Kids Can't Read ThemBy Mark PygasUpdated June 10 2023, 8:58 a.m. ET Source: istockIn the age of Fortnite, most of what we do is now on a screen. Whether it's checking Twitter, watching Netflix, or even doing homework. And that's had quite a drastic effect in the United Kingdom, where teachers are now installing digital clocks in exam rooms because their children are having a difficult time reading analogue clocks and knowing how much time they have left during stressful exams.

Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Saturday, 22nd May, 2021
item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today Saturday, 22nd May 2021. The Chief of Army Staff, Ibrahim Attahiru has reportedly died in a military plane crash which occurred in Kaduna State. The incident occurred on Friday at the Kaduna International Airport according to military sources. It was learnt that the ill-fated aircraft crashed at the airport’s runway about 6 pm and about eight people on board are all feared dead.

item.title: Uhuru urges Kenyans to buy, wear locally-made shirts, shows off own collection
item.description: - African-print shirts that are motsly made at Rivatex in Eldoret have become part of President Uhuru Kenyatta's household design clothes - The design originated in Indonesia in the 1880s where a method of wax-resist dyeing called batik was used - The head of state has consistently maintained wearing the shirts and has always encouraged Kenyans to wear them Since the coronavirus pandemic, President Uhuru Kenyatta has been very consistent in wearing locally manufactured shirts during his address to the nation.

item.title: Who Wore Kate Middleton's Ring First? The History Behind the Ring
item.description: Kate Middleton's engagement ring is a family heirloom from the royal family. Here's how it was passed down over the years, including the history of its origin. When Prince William proposed to Kate Middleton years ago, the ring he used was a diamond-circled, 12-carat oval sapphire ring that once belonged to his mother, Princess Diana. Article continues below advertisement The ring, while only a few decades old itself, still holds great value to the royal family.

item.title: Angelina Jolie - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her role in the 1999 film Girl, Interrupted. She played lead roles in the films Maleficent, Salt, Changeling, Lara Croft: Tomb Raider, and Mr. & Mrs. Smith and directed the 2014 film Unbroken. In 2019, she was cast as superhero Thena in the Marvel film The Eternals. Before Fame She dropped out of acting classes at the age of fourteen and aspired to become a funeral director. Trivia She received a Golden Globe Award for her role in the 1997 TV movie George Wallace.

item.title: Bjorn Ulvaeus - Age, Family, Bio

Before Fame He studied business and law at Lund University. Trivia Before singing in ABBA, he performed with the Hootenanny Singers, a popular band in Scandinavia. Songs he worked on are featured in the hit film Mamma Mia! Family Life He married Agnetha Fältskog on July 6, 1971; after their divorce on June 9, 1980, he married Lena Kallersjö on January 5, 1981.

item.title: 'List Of Countries Mr Ibu Was More Celebrated When He Was Alive'
item.description: Dominic Nwuzoru, manager of late Nollywood comic actor, John Okafor, popularly known as Mr Ibu, has revealed that the late movie star was even more celebrated in other African countries like Ghana, South Africa, Kenya, Tanzania, Gambia, Gabon and Botswana when he was alive. Naija News recalls that Mr Ibu died of cardiac arrest at the age of 62 in Lagos last weekend. In an interview with journalists on Sunday in Abuja, Dominic recalled how Mr Ibu used humour to promote peace and unity across Africa.

item.title: BBI Ilikuwa ya Matajiri wa Kisiasa, Mudavadi Sasa Asema
item.description: Mudavadi alisema BBI ilianguka kwa sababu ya kiburi cha baadhi ya viongozi waliohusika kuendesha zoezi hiloAlisema waliokuwa na maoni mbadala hawakupewa nafasi ya kuskizwa wakati wa kujadili masuala ya BBIWandani wa Mudavadi pia wameonya chama cha ODM dhidi ya jaribio la kumfurusha Wafula Chebukati kutoka IEBCKiongozi wa chama cha Amani National Congress (ANC) Musalia Mudavadi amelaumu Rais Uhuru Kenyatta na Raila Odinga baada ya mahakama kutupa nje BBI. Akiongea Jumapili Agosti 22 wakati wa hafla ya injili katika Friends Church Ngong Road, Mudavadi alisema miaka mitatu iliyotumiwa kuandaa BBI itakuwa ni kazi bure.

item.title: Biodun Oyebanji Wins Ekiti APC Primary Election With Over 100,000 Votes
item.description: Mr Biodun Oyebanji has won the All Progressives Congress (APC) governorship primary election in Ekiti state. Naija News reports that APC conducted its primary elections in the state today to produce a flag bearer ahead of the June governorship election in the state. Oyebanji polled 101,703 votes, while his closest challengers; Ojo Kayode had 767, Opeyemi Bamidele had 760 and Dayo Adeyeye polled 691 votes. The results of the primary election from all the 16 LGAs in Ekiti state were announced by Governor Mohammed Badaru, chairman of the election committee, who declared Biodun Oyebanji as the winner.

item.title: Nigeria's Oil Revenue Surges By 83%
item.description: A recent publication by the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) has shown that Nigeria’s crude oil revenue increased by 83.23 per cent to N8.54 trillion in the third quarter of 2023. This is as Nigeria’s foreign trade in the period under review experienced a rise by 53.16 per cent year-on-year to N 18.80tn, Naija News understands. In the previous year’s third quarter, only N4.66tn was recorded in crude oil sales.

item.title: Those Thieves Must Be Part Of The Discussion
item.description: The candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in the 2023 governorship election in Rivers State, Tonye Cole, has suggested ways to end oil bunkering that has become a menace in the country. According to him, oil thieves must be brought to the table to be part of the discussion, only then can there be a way forward, Naija News reports. item.title: 'Buhari Was A Victim' - Garba Shehu Urges Nigerians To Lower Expectations For Tinubu
item.description: Former presidential spokesperson, Garba Shehu, has urged Nigerians to lower their expectations for President Bola Ahmed Tinubu and other presidents to come. Naija News reports that Shehu, while speaking at the 21st Trust Dialogue with the theme:” Tinubu’s Economic Reforms: Gainers and Losers”, said ex-President Muhammadu Buhari was a victim of the crisis of expectations. The ex-Senior Special Assistant on Media and Publicity to Buhari said some of his former principal’s problems resulted from the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 and the war between Russia and Ukraine in 2022, which affected grain importation.

item.title: El-Rufai Loses To Shehu Sani In Court
item.description: The immediate past Governor of Kaduna State, Nasir El-Rufai on Thursday lost a court case against his political rival and former federal lawmaker, Senator Shehu Sani. It was gathered that a Kaduna High Court dismissed a defamation suit filed by El-Rufai against Sani. In the suit filed in 2018, the former Governor had sought N2 billion in damages over comments credited to the former lawmaker which he said are totally false and injurious to his person in the eyes of the public.

item.title: How Pele Played A Peace Role In Nigeria's Civil War
item.description: The demise of Brazilian football icon, Pele on Thursday, December 29, has brought back the good memories of the football icon and the enormous impact he made in the world. Pele lived for 82 years and used over 22 years of that to play football and the rest to serve humanity in his capacity. One of the biggest impacts he made in the world was halting the Nigeria civil war for at least 48 hours due to the love people had for him.

The gunmen were said to have surrounded the farm and started shooting sporadically before abducting the labourers including boys and girls.

item.title: FG Set To End Fuel Scarcity
item.description: Minister of Petroleum Resources, Mrs Diezani Alison-Madueke yesterday said her ministry has begun a probe of the current fuel scarcity across the country,vowing to deal with forces behind the scarcity. She blamed the scarcity on hoarding and diversion of the products by some dealers, a development she said was born out of selfishness . Addressing newsmen after a closed- door meeting with the House of Representatives joint committees on petroleum Upstream, Downstream and Gas , the minister assured that the situation was now under control .

item.title: DSS Opens Up On Reported Joint Operation With American Troops In Abuja
item.description: The Department of State Services (DSS) has denied viral reports that its operatives and some American soldiers carried out a raid against terrorists in Abuja, Nigeria’s capital city. The spokesperson of the DSS, Peter Afunanya who made the denial said what was widely reported in the media is false. Afunanya, however, went ahead to confirm a sting operation in an Abuja estate by the DSS but denied the involvement of American or other foreign security forces.

item.title: Hunter Injures Man On Toilet While Aiming At Moose
item.description: A Norwegian hunter accidentally hit a man sitting on the toilet while aiming at a moose. The man missed and accidentally hit a man sitting on the toilet in a nearby cabin while aiming at a moose, according to police. The bullet whizzed past the animal, pierced the wooden wall behind it and struck the man in the stomach. The victim, who is in his seventies, was flown by helicopter to hospital but his injury was not life-threatening, said the policeman who led the investigation.

item.title: Nigerians Have Been Robbed - Peter Obi Breaks Silence On Presidential Election

He said: “Be rest assured that I and my running mate, Datti Baba-Ahmed will not rest.” The presidential candidate said he and his running mate remaining undaunted and committed to the project of a new Nigeria.

Before Fame In May of 2019, she shared a cover performance of Cyndi Lauper's "Time After Time." Trivia She knows how to play the guitar, the ukulele, and the piano. She has performed covers of popular songs from The Beatles and The Eagles.

With much of the world practicing social distancing, it's a great game to play while sitting at home away from your friends.

item.title: Operational Textile Companies In Nigeria Drop From 175 To 20 Senator Jibrin
item.description: A former Chairman of the Textile Manufacturers Association of Nigeria, Senator Walid Jibrin, has revealed that Nigeria currently has only 20 operational textile industries. Jibrin, who expressed concerns over the continued collapse of the industry, said there were no fewer than 175 functional textile industries in Nigeria a few years ago. Naija News understands that Jibrin noted this during a brief chat with newsmen in Kaduna. He remarked that the textile industry used to be the second employer of labour after the government.

item.title: A Parrot and a Dog Play Matchmaker in Hallmarks Fly Away With Me
item.description: What were the ‘Fly Away With Me’ filming locations? Learn more about the TV movie starring Natalie Hall and Peter Mooney and premiering on Sept. 24. Source: Johnson Production Group/Hallmark MediaAn avian home intruder, a canine stowaway, an aspiring writer, and an air traffic controller are four of the disparate characters you’ll meet in Fly Away With Me, airing tonight, Saturday, Sept. 24, at 8 p.m. ET on Hallmark Channel.

item.title: Africa Got Talent: Ghanaian Student Atta Gad Builds Flying Plane with Can of Malt
item.description: There are many unearthed talents in Africa and young Master Atta Gad is one of themThe JHS student managed to build a plane with the rarest of products - an empty malt canAfter days and nights of working on his masterpiece, Gad tested his invention outdoors and it actually fliesPAY ATTENTION: Help us change more lives, join TUKO.co.ke’s Patreon programme Atta Gad, a student of Dr Saunders Memorial School in the Kintampo North Municipality, has dazzled his mates, teachers and the entire community with his invention.

item.title: Did a Rioter Taser Himself to Death? Viral Capitol Riot Post Explained
item.description: That Rumor That a D.C. Rioter Tasered Himself to Death Is (Probably) Just a JokeBy Dan ClarendonPublished Jan. 9 2021, 2:45 p.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesDid a rioter taser himself to death during the mob attack on the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday, Jan. 6? So far, it seems no one’s been able to confirm this viral rumor. According to a Know Your Meme submission still under review, the testicle-tasering details is a hoax about Kevin Greeson, one of the five casualties of the riot, dying of a heart attack after accidentally shocking himself in the testicles with a taser while trying to steal a portrait of former Speaker of the House Tip O’Neill.

item.title: Laughs As Osinbajo Sings Kizz Daniel's 'Buga At Tourism Conference In Lagos
item.description: After displaying his singing and dancing skills, the Vice President (VP), Yemi Osinbajo, got people laughing today in Lagos at the World Tourism Organisation global conference in Iganmu. Naija News understands that the number two citizen, while addressing dignitaries at the conference, sang the popular Nigerian song ‘Buga’ by Kizz Daniel to buttress his point that music is a global language. The VP’s demonstration got the attendees smiling and laughing as they also joined in chorusing the song at Osinbajo’s request.

item.title: Nigeria Vs Cameroon 2023 AFCON Preview, Team News, Kick-Off Time, Prediction
item.description: At 9 p.m. on Saturday, January 27, two of the biggest rivals in African football, Cameroon and Nigeria will go head to head in the 2023 AFCON round of 16 at the Stade Félix Houphouët-Boigny in Abidjan, Ivory Coast. This meeting will make it the 8th time the Super Eagles of Nigeria and the Indomitable Lions of Cameroon are meeting in AFCON. And it is a meeting between a solid defense and goals-shy attack (Nigeria) and a free-scoring and loose defense (Cameroon).

item.title: I Am Still A PDP Member, Wike Insists
item.description: The Minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) and immediate past governor of Rivers State, Nyesom Wike, has reaffirmed his membership of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) despite recent frictions and threats of expulsion from party chieftains. Naija News recalls that Wike’s political journey took an unexpected turn during the run-up to the 2023 presidential election, leading to a fallout with the PDP hierarchy over his insistence on adhering to the party’s internal power-sharing formula, which he believed should have zoned the presidential ticket to southern Nigeria.

item.title: Jared Followill - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Musician known for being the bassist for Kings of Leon. The band's most successful album was Only by the Night, released in 2008, and went platinum in the US and Australia. Before Fame After a childhood of traveling, Jared settled in Nashville with his brothers and cousin in 1999, at which point they formed the band. Trivia His father was a pentecostal preacher. The band was named after their late grandfather Leon.

item.title: President Buhari Rejects State Police, Gives Reasons
item.description: Nigeria’s President, Muhammadu Buhari has disclosed the clamour for state police will not solve the security challenges facing the country. Naija News reports that there have been calls from Southern Governors, groups and some notable Nigerians for the creation ofstate police in order to address the insecurity in the land. However, in an interview with Channels Television, Buhari said that state police was not a good option for curbing the unrest in the nation.

item.title: Treyten - Age, Family, Bio
Contesting Against APC's Sanwo-Olu In Lagos A Waste Of Time
item.description: The Governor of Rivers State, Nyesom Wike, on Tuesday openly endorsed Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu of Lagos State for a second term in office. Naija News reports that Wike endorsed Sanwo-Olu despite his political party, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), fielding Olajide Adeniran, also known as jandor, as its governorship candidate. The Rivers Governor pitched his tent with his Lagos counterpart while speaking at the 22nd National Women’s Conference organized by the Committee of Wives of Lagos State Officials (COWLSO).

item.title: David Friedrich - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Drummer who rose to fame as the 2012 replacement of Michael Malitzki in the German electronicore band Eskimo Callboy. He went on to win the German version of The Bachelorette in 2017. Before Fame He began drumming at the age of eight. Before officially joining Eskimo Callboy, he spent more than six years playing with his deathcore band Beast War Returns. Trivia Eskimo Callboy has supported a variety of popular acts like Her Bright Skies and To the Rats and Wolves on their European tours.

item.title: Harvey Petito - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Australian teen model and actor who has been featured in campaigns for Seed Heritage, Witchery, Pavement Brands, Peter Alexander, Cotton On, Target, and Kmart. He scored small roles in the Australian feature films Lucy's Bedtime and Emo the Musical and landed a role on the show House Husbands in 2017. Before Fame He earned representation with Bayside Modeling Agency at the age of nine after previously modeling for other agencies for two years.

item.title: Osun 2022: I Don't Owe Workers Salaries Unlike Some People
item.description: Governor Gboyega Oyetola of Osun State has promised the continued prompt and full payment of workers’ salaries and pension. The governor also vowed never to betray the trust the electorate reposed in him if re-elected into office ahead of the July 16 state governorship election. Oyetola made the remarks during an engagement programme organised by the State’s Civic Engagement Centre in Ijimo village in Oriade Local Government Area of Osun State on Sunday.

item.title: APC Releases Timetable For Congresses
item.description: The Caretaker Extra-Ordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) has released its timetable for the conduct of party’s congresses from the ward to zonal levels. Naija News reports that the APC was however silent on the conduct of its National Convention. Secretary to the Committee, Senator John James Akpanduoehehe, disclosed these to newsmen at the party secretariat in Abuja after their meeting under Gov. Mai Mala Buni.

item.title: Ex-Yobe Governorship Aspirant Leads 1,000 APC Members' Defection To PDP
item.description: No fewer than a thousand members of the ruling All Progressive Congress (APC), have reportedly defected to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Yobe State. A governorship aspirant in the 2019 general election, Dr Aji Kolomi, reportedly led a group of the defectors to the opposition party, Naija News learnt. Confirming the development, PDP’s Publicity Secretary in Yobe, Hon. Salihu Mohammed Baba, said in a statement made available to newsmen on Thursday that Kolomi joined the umbrella camp alongside hundreds of his supporters and were received at the party’s secretariat in Damaturu, the state capital.

item.title: Manti Te'o - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: NFL linebacker who was selected in the second round of the 2013 NFL Draft by the San Diego Chargers. He joined the New Orleans Saints in 2017. Before Fame He played football college at Notre Dame from 2009-2012, where he became one of the most decorated college football players of all time, including eight national awards. Trivia His senior year of college, he gained media attention for his infamous dead girlfriend hoax, where he made up a story about a fake girlfriend.

item.title: Oronsaye Report Outdated, Wont Reduce Governance Cost Falana
item.description: Renowned human rights lawyer, Femi Falana, has voiced his concerns over the Federal Executive Council’s (FEC) recent decision to fully implement the 12-year-old Steve Oronsaye Report, which suggests the merger of various government agencies and commissions. Falana, a Senior Advocate of Nigeria, issued a statement on Tuesday, labeling the report as outdated and doubting its efficacy in significantly reducing the government’s operational costs in its current form. The FEC, under the leadership of President Bola Tinubu, had approved the report’s implementation on Monday, with Special Adviser to the President on Policy Coordination, Hadiza Bala Usman, citing the urgent need for cost reduction and increased efficiency in governance as the primary motivations for this move.

item.title: You Are Not The Only Voice Of Nigerians
item.description: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has warned protesting labour unions in the country against causing unrest. Naija News reports that the Nigerian leader gave the warning in his speech on Thursday during the inauguration of the Red Line Rail Project in Lagos. Tinubu, who said he watched how people are demonstrating across the country over the ongoing hardship, said that unions must not hide under the guise of human rights to cause unrest.

item.title: Len Goodman - Trivia, Family, Bio

item.description: - Waziri Matiang'i ametangaza Ijumaa, Julai 31 kuwa siku ya mapumziko - Hii ni kwa ajili ya kuwapa Waislamu fursa ya kusherehekea siku kuu ya Idd-Ul-Azha - Waislamu hutumia Eid ul-Adha kusherehekea utiifu kamili wa nabii Ibrahimu kwa amri ya Mungu na kuwakumbusha wenyewe kuwa tayari kutoa kafara Waziri wa Usalama wa Ndani Fred Matiang'i ametangaza kuwa Ijumaa, Julai 31, itakuwa siku ya mapumziko kwa Wakenya wote ili kusherehekea siku kuu ya Idd-Ul-Azha.

item.title: Taio Cruz - Age, Family, Bio
Umahi's Bans Political Rallies In Schools, Restricts Movement Of Okada In Ebonyi
item.description: Ahead of the 2023 general election, the Ebonyi State Governor, David Umahi, has placed a ban on any form of political rallies in all the state’s primary and secondary schools starting from November 1, 2022. Naija News reports that Umahi said the ban affects all political parties including the All Progressives Congress (APC). According to him, political parties must get approval from the Commissioner of Education before any such rally can hold in any school space.

item.title: What Happened to Roli on Counting Cars? He Branched out on His Own
item.description: Roli hasn't been on ‘Counting Cars’ in years and with Season 9 in full swing, some fans might have forgotten what happened to him. As another Pawn Stars spin-off, Counting Cars could have been a one-season and done show. But, by the grace of the reality TV gods, it soldiered on, and in June 2020, Season 9 premiered. There have been some changes throughout the years, however, including getting to know and then losing Roli Szabo when he left the show.

item.title: Osun Poll: 'It Is Going To Be A Landslide If The Election Is Free And Fair'
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party, (PDP) governorship candidate Ademola Adeleke has expressed optimism about winning the Osun State election, scheduled for July 16th. Speaking during an interview on Arise TV Adeleke claimed he would win in a landslide if the election is conducted free and fair. He also accused the All Progressives Congress (APC) of bringing thugs from Lagos to disrupt the election, adding they are shooting everywhere in the state.

item.title: US To Return $23m Abacha Loot To Nigeria
item.description: The United State Government (US) is set to return over $23 million Abacha loot to the federal government of Nigeria. This is coming after Nigeria and the US government reached an agreement on the loot. The agreement signing ceremony was held in the office of the Attorney General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami on Tuesday, Naija News understands. The US Ambassador to Nigeria, Mary Beth Leonard signed on the behalf of the US government, while Malami signed on behalf of the Nigerian government.

item.title: Court Of Appeal Relocates Kogi Governorship Election Petitions Tribunal To Abuja
item.description: Justice Monica Dongban-Mensem, President of the Court of Appeal, has ordered the relocation of the Kogi Governorship Election Petitions Tribunal from Lokoja to Abuja. According to a statement released by David Umar Mike, Secretary of the Tribunal, future sittings will take place at the National Judicial Institute on Umar Yar’Adua Way, and litigants are advised to note the venue change. While the statement did not specify the reason for the relocation, a high-ranking tribunal source who spoke with Vanguard indicated it was due to security concerns.

item.title: Frank Sinatra (Pop Singer) - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Swing-era singing icon who won eleven Grammy Awards, including the Legend Award and the Lifetime Achievement Award for his timeless hits, like "Come Fly With Me." Before Fame He was raised by his father, the lightweight boxer Marty O'Brien and his mother, Natalie Garaventa, who ran an abortion clinic out of her home. He was kicked out of high school due to excessive rowdiness. Trivia He also went by the nicknames Ol' Blue Eyes and The Chairman of the Board.

item.title: Korede Bello Returns To School
item.description: Mavin Records artiste Korede Bello has returned back to school. Korede Bello had his Matriculation today  at the Nigeria Institute of Journalist (NIJ) which held at NIJ Premise in Ogba to study a Higher National Diploma in mass communication. [article_adwert] Revcently Korede won ‘The Song of the Year’ award at the 4th Annual Golden Icons Academy Movie Awards (GIAMA) that held last night in Houston, Texas. The event was hosted by Nigerian comedian and actor AY Makun. Korede Bello released his follow up single, ‘Somebody Great’ about a week ago and the song has since gathered massive air play and acceptance for the messages inherent in it.

item.title: Reno Omokri Reacts As Atiku Wins PDP Presidential Primary Election
item.description: Controversial author, Reno Omokri has reacted as former Vice President Atiku Abubakar emerges as the People Democratic Party’s flagbearer for the 2023 presidential election. Naija News reports Atiku defeated all other aspirants with a wide margin to emerge the winner of Saturday’s primary election held at the Moshood Abiola National Stadium in Abuja. Atiku will now be the official candidate of the PDP for the 2023 presidential election in Nigeria.

item.title: Top 10 functions of literature everyone should know about
item.description: Have you ever thought about the functions of literature? Sometimes we underestimate the importance of literature in our lives, but thanks to it, we can learn new things about the world, experience emotions, both good and bad, etc. Other functions of literature include entertainment, cultural purposes, education, criticism of social ills, and more. There are various explanations for what literature means. Still, one of the common notions in most of the definitions of literature is that it involves written texts and spoken materials in some cases.

item.title: Dana Carvey - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Saturday Night Live alumnus who starred in Wayne's World. He gained additional fame for his impersonations of George H.W. Bush on Saturday Night Live. Before Fame He played the guitar and the drums as a teenager. He earned a B.A. degree in broadcast communications from SF State University. Trivia He voiced the character Dana in the 2015 animated feature Hotel Transylvania 2. Family Life His brother Brad Carvey invented the Video Toaster. His parents were both teachers; his father Bud taught business and his mother Billie Dahl taught grade school students.

item.title: Heather Locklear - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress best known for her role as Amanda Woodward on Melrose Place, which earned her four Golden Globe nominations for Best Actress. Other notable roles include Officer Stacy Sheridan on T.J. Hooker, Caitlin Moore on Spin City and Chloe on Hot in Cleveland. Before Fame She studied at UCLA and began modeling and acting in school-related commercials. Trivia In 2002, she had a recurring role on the NBC sitcom Scrubs. Family Life She was married to Tommy Lee from 1986 to 1993 and Richie Sambora from 1994 to 2007.

item.description: Former media aide to ex-President Goodluck Jonathan, Reno Omokri has alleged that a top Northern politician who is also a member of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) wished death for President Muhammadu Buhari in a leaked audio. Omokri identified the politician as Sulaiman Adamu, adding that the APC chieftain is frustrated like many other Nigerians, and he and his allies were heard in the audio lamenting the hardship and insecurity in the north.

item.title: Mickey Mantle - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Legendary New York Yankee who hit 536 career home runs, was named American League MVP three times, and led the AL in home runs four times and batting average once. He won the Triple Crown in 1956 and totaled 7 World Series Championships in his 18-year career. Before Fame He made his MLB debut on April 17, 1951 for the New York Yankees. Trivia He was named to 20 All-Star games during his career, from 1951 to 1968.

item.title: Obi Supporters Storm Okowas Hometown For One Million-Man March (Photos)
item.description: Thousands of supporters of the presidential candidate of the Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi, on Thursday staged a one million march today at the hometown of Delta State Governor and vice presidential candidate of the People’s Democratic Party (PDP), Ifeanyi Okowa. Naija News reports that Obi supporters converged at Owa-Alero, occupying major streets in Agbor, in Ika North-East Local Government of Delta, on Saturday. The march, which is part of the support for the Obi/Datti 2023 presidential ticket, saw many of the youths donning the paraphernalia of LP and its candidate.

item.title: PDP, Atiku Will Defeat Peter Obi In Anambra Okowa
item.description: Governor of Delta State, Ifeanyi Okowa, on Sunday, boasted that the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) will sweep the polls in Anambra State in the coming 2023 general elections, Naija News reports. Okowa who is a running mate to PDP presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar, said the nation’s leading opposition party has won polls in a landslide in the state before and that the coming election will not be an exception. Recall that Labour Party presidential candidate, Peter Obi, hails from Anambra State and the state is currently headed by the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA) led by Governor Charles Chukwuma Soludo.

item.title: We Have No Candidate In Bayelsa, Imo, Kogi Elections
item.description: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has said the electoral agency has no candidate in the November 11 governorship elections in Bayelsa, Imo and Kogi States. The Chairman of the Commission, Professor Mahmood Yakubu, made this known in a statement made available to journalists in Abuja on Thursday. Yakubu also pledged to ensure a level playing field for all political parties and candidates in the elections, adding that the staff of the Commission are ready for the off-cycle elections.

item.title: Ganduje Reacts As Appeal Court Sacks Abba Yusuf As Kano Governor
item.description: The National Chairman of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC), Abdullahi Ganduje, hailed the Court of Appeal ruling which sacked Governor Abba Yusuf of Kano State. Naija News earlier reported that the appeal court affirmed the ruling of the Tribunal, which sacked Governor Yusuf, the candidate of the New Nigeria Peoples Party (NNPP) in the March 18 governorship election. In a judgment delivered on Friday, a three-member appellate court panel affirmed Nasiru Gawuna of the All Progressives Congress (APC) as the election winner.

item.title: Only One of Robert Shinn's Children Still Speaks to Him
item.description: Two of Robert Shinn's Children Have Left the Church He FoundedTwo of Robert Shinn's three children have more or less stopped speaking to him, an alleged cult leader. Dancing for the Devil: The 7M TikTok Cult takes a look at Robert Shinn and the two organizations he founded and has full control over — 7M Films and the Shekinah Church.

item.title: Tears as Governor Ambode donates N5m to widow of burnt kidnap victim
item.description: - Governor Akinwunmi Ambode of Lagos state has donated N5 million to the widow of Osaze Omorogbe, a community leader killed and burnt by kidnappers in Ikorodu - The late Omorogbe was killed and burnt while leading security agents to kidnappers’ hideout in Ikorodu area of Lagos - Ambode said the late Omoregbe paid the supreme sacrifice while responding to the government’s charge to community development Governor Akinwunmi Ambode of Lagos state has donated N5 million to the widow and children of Osaze Omorogbe, a community leader killed and burnt by kidnappers for leading security agents to foil their operation.

item.title: 'Rock the Block' Season 2 Will Be Even Bigger and Better Than Season 1
item.description: Season 2 of ‘Rock the Block’ has moved neighborhoods, and after the trailer was released, fans want to know where 'Rock the Block' was filmed. This means that Season 2 will get a whole new makeover, just like the houses on the show. Rock the Block Season 2 will be in a different neighborhood where there will be some different rules, different contestants, a different host, and different judges, but with the same basic premise.

item.description: - Watu 260 walipaytwa na covid-19 Jumapili, Juni 21 huku wawili nao wakifariki - Wengi wa idadi hiyo ni kutoka kaunti ya Nairobi 157, na Mombasa wagonjwa 43 - Kagwe aliomba msamaha kwa wote waliowekwa karantini siku za mwanzo za covid-19 humu nchini na kuumia Watu 260 wamepatawa na virusi vya coronavirus na kufikisha idadi ya maambukizi kuwa 4738. item.title: What Is #SaveMinecraft and Should Gamers Really Be Worried?
item.description: Do We Really Need to #SaveMinecraft Following the 1.19 Update?By Sam BramlettPublished Aug. 29 2022, 10:44 a.m. ET Source: Mojang StudiosThe latest updates to Minecraft rules were designed to make multiplayer safer and more inclusive by adding the ability to report other players. The sandbox game has always been about celebrating creative freedom, and to many, the new report function goes against that freedom. The #SaveMinecraft has trended on Twitter since July, with players up in arms at the ease with which bans can be doled out.

item.title: FFK Reveals Why Igbos Will Break Away From Nigeria Soon
item.description: Chief Femi Fani-Kayode, has explained why the Igbos are most likely to break away from Nigeria in no distant future. The former director of publicity, Peoples Democratic Presidential Campaign Organisation (PDPPCO), who made his statement on Monday, carpeted Dr Junaid Mohammed, convener of the Coalition of Northern Politicians, Academics, Professionals and Businessmen, for saying that president Muhammadu Buhari owes Igbos nothing. According to Vanguard, FFK, as the politician is fondly called, described Dr Junaid's comments as most insensitive, cruel and puerile, adding that the statement, asking the Igbos to break away if they felt marginalised, was most uncharitable and careless.

item.title: 20 Killed, 5,000 Displaced As Gunmen Attack 12 Nasarawa Communities
item.description: Gunmen suspected to be herdsmen have killed 20 farmers and displaced 5,000 others during an attack on 12 communities in Lafia, Obi, and Awe Local Government Areas of Nasarawa State. Naija News reports that the President of Tiv Development Association in the state, Peter Ahemba, confirmed this on Monday. Ahemba asserted that 20 corpses have been recovered with the support of security agencies, adding that many residents are still missing.

item.title: Gumi In 'More Trouble' As PANDEF Warns Him To Stay Away From The South-South
item.description: The Pan Niger Delta Forum (PANDEF) has warned prominent Islamic cleric, Sheikh Ahmad Gumi to stay away from the South-South over the statement credited to him that Christian soldiers are responsible for banditry and violence in the country. PANDEF in a statement released on Wednesday also called on the federal government to declare Gumi’s submission on the matter as hate speech. It will be recalled that Gumi had accused non-Muslim soldiers of launching attacks on villages and communities leading bandits to seek vengeance.

item.description: Governor Kayode Fayemi of Ekiti State, on Thursday, played host to his predecessor, Ayodele Fayose, his Jigawa and Akwa Ibom states counterparts, Badaru Abubakar and Udom Emmanuel. Naija News reports that this was made known in a Facebook post on Thursday by Governor Fayemi. This newspaper observed that the politicians were in a jolly mood in the photos shared on the page. item.description: Want to know how to add music to your Instagram Notes? One of the newest functions to the social media platform got a considerable upgrade. Source: Getty ImagesSocial media platforms like Instagram are always releasing new buttons and functions right under our noses. Sometimes, they're as simple but visually noticeable as making the Story Icons bigger. Other times, they'll be completely new and unexpected, like adding music to photo posts. Back in December 2022, Instagram even added Notes to your DMs, though you may not have noticed if you don't open your messages all that often.

item.title: 'American Crime Story' Latest News and Updates
item.description: The anthology true-crime series American Crime Story is a spinoff of the FX series, American Horror Story. Each season is a self-contained mini-series centered on a true-life event. The first season, subtitled, The People v. O.J. Simpson, chronicled the murder trial of O.J. Simpson while the second season, chronicled the murder of Italian fashion designer Gianni Versace by Andrew Cunanan. Season 3 of American Crime Story will focus on the Clinton-Lewinsky scandal and is based on the book, A Vast Conspiracy: The Real Story of the Sex Scandal That Nearly Brought Down a President.

item.title: Falz Reveals What Will Happen If Everyone Participate In 2023 Elections
item.description: Nigerian rapper,Falz has stated that whoever wins the forthcoming general elections would be active, if everyone participate in it. item.title: VIDEO: What TB Joshua Did To My Daughter
item.description: Nollywood actress Ronke Ojo, popularly known as Oshodi-Oke, has rubbished the recent allegations against the late founder of the Synagogue Church of All Nations (SCOAN), Prophet TB Joshua. Naija News reported that the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) on Monday, January 8, released a documentary of alleged eyewitness accounts of rape, fake miracles, torture, and forced abortions committed by the late prophet. In a video shared on her Instagram page on Friday, Ronke recounted her encounter with the late clergyman, insisting he was a nice and good man of God.

item.title: DMCA | Distractify
item.description: Engrost, Inc. ("Company") has adopted the following general policy toward copyright infringement in accordance with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (http://lcweb.loc.gov/copyright/legislation/dmca.pdf). The address of the Designated Agent to Receive Notification of Claimed Infringement ("Designated Agent") is listed at the end of this policy. Procedure for Reporting Copyright Infringement: A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on behalf of the owner of the copyright that has been allegedly infringed; Identification of works or materials being infringed; Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing including information regarding the location of the infringing materials that the copyright owner seeks to have removed, with sufficient detail so that Company is capable of finding and verifying its existence; Contact information about the notifier including address, telephone number and, if available, e-mail address; A statement that the notifier has a good faith belief that the material is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; and A statement made under penalty of perjury that the information provided is accurate and the notifying party is authorized to make the complaint on behalf of the copyright owner.

item.title: I'm Still APC Caretaker National Secretary
item.description: The National Secretary of the Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Senator John James Akpanudoedehe has denied resigning his position. Naija News earlier reported that Akpanudoedehe had left the party’s national secretariat at Blantyre Street, Wuse 2, Abuja, with all his belongings on Tuesday. The former lawmaker reportedly tendered his resignation letter to the acting caretaker chairman of the APC, Governor Abubakar Sani-Bello of Niger State.

item.title: Kenny Wallace - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: NASCAR veteran made over 500 stars and was named 1989 Busch Series Rookie of the Year. Before Fame He began working as a mechanic for his father's race cars, then won the first race he entered, the Illinois Street Stock State Championship. Trivia In addition to his on-track accomplishments, he joined the SPEED TV network as an on-air personality, appearing on NASCAR RaceDay and NASCAR Victory Lane. Family Life He had three daughters with his wife Kim.

item.title: Mara Elena Dvila - Edad, Familia, Biografa
item.description: Acerca De Actriz que se convirtió en centro de atención al interpretar a la pianista Jennifer Andrade en la telenovela de Telemundo En Otra Piel. En el 2014, asumió el papel principal de Matilda Valverde en otra telenovela titulada Voltea Pa' Que te Enamores. Antes de la Fama Estudió cine y teatro en Nueva York. Curiosidades En septiembre del 2017, reveló que padece la afección tiroidea conocida como enfermedad de Hashimoto.

item.title: Fire Guts Building In Ilorin, Destroys N19 Million Property
item.description: Property valued at over N19 million was reportedly destroyed in a fire outbreak on Tuesday evening in Ilorin, the capital of Kwara State. Naija News learnt that the incident happened at Zion Overcomer, opposite Duro Suleiman’s house on the University of Ilorin Road, within the Ilorin South Local Government Area. The fire was said to have started at approximately 17:50 hours. Thanks to the swift response of the firefighting agency in the state capital, which put out the raging fire and prevented the flames from spreading to neighbouring facilities.

item.title: Hali ya wasiwasi yatanda Uganda, Bobi Wine atoweka kufuatia kuuawa kwa dereva wake na polisi
item.description: - Dereva wake mbunge Bobi Wine aliuawa na maafisa wa polisi siku ya Jumatatu, Agosti 13 - Mbunge huyo alidai kuwa ndiye aliyekuwa amelengwa na badala yake dereva yake akauawa Hali ya wasiwasi imetanda nchini Uganda kufuatia kuawa kwa dereva wake Bobi Wine mjini Arua wakati wa kampeni. Habari Nyingine: Mjukuu wa rais mstaafu Daniel Moi awazuzua wasichana mtandaoni Kulingana na mkewe Bobi, Barbie Kyalanyi, Wine na wenzake saba wa familia yake wamekuwa hawapatikani hata kwa simu tangu wakati huo.

item.title: Jerin muhimman kalmomin hausa 20 da ma'anar su a harshen turanci
item.description: Shin kun san sunayen ababen nan a harshen turanci kuwa? Da yawan mu mun tsammaci wasu ababen da mu ke amfani da su a gargajiyance ko a Kasar nan ta mu, sun kebanta gare mu ne kadai. Mai yiwuwa wasun mu su yi tsammanin ababe irin su gwate, dambu, dinya da dai sauran su, ba su da sunaye a harshen turanci. To albashirinku, turawa da wasu launin bil'adama su na amfani da wadansu daga cikin su ko makamantan su.

item.title: Naij.com Reader Appeals To Re-Elected Rauf Aregbesola
item.description: It's been over a month since the All Progressives Congress' candidate Rauf Aregbesola has won the governshorship election in Osun State. Legit.ng guest writer Onagbenga Ahunso appeals to Governor Aregbesola, advising him on future actions. "The re-election of Rauf Aregbesola as governor of Osun State is not without few implications. The self-styled "Omoluabi" and the APC government must understand this. Those who voted for change on August 9 are too significant to ignore. Their fears must be allayed.

item.title: Shannade Clermont - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Television personality, model and actress who was seen on season 14 of Oxygen's Bad Girls Club alongside her identical twin sister Shannon Clermont. She and Shannon share a joint Instagram account, which has amassed over 1.7 million fans.  Before Fame She began attending top fashion schools in New York City in pursuit of a Bachelor's degree while also beginning her career in entertainment. Trivia She earned the nickname of The Power Princess. Family Life She and her twin sister Shannon were born in Montclair, New Jersey and lived in Georgia for ten years before relocating to New York City.

item.title: Angie Dickinson - Age, Family, Bio
Dick Clark - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Television and radio spokesman who won a Daytime Emmy Lifetime Achievement Award in 1994 for hosting American Bandstand. Before Fame He began his career in the mailroom of WRUN in Rome, New York. Trivia He was known as America's Oldest Teenager. He won five Emmy Awards and introduced rock n' roll music to the American public. Family Life His marriage ceremony to Kari Clark began at 7 p.m. on 7/7/77. He had two sons, Duane and Richard, and a daughter, Cindy.

Source: Getty ImagesRepresentative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez aka "AOC" is no stranger to speaking her mind and standing up for herself (and others). She once again had the floor in the House of Representatives and condemned Republican Representative Ted Yoho for his sexist attack on her in front of the U.

item.title: South-East Governors Attacked Over New Military Exercise
item.description: The South-East Governors have been slammed for allowing the Nigerian Army to launch an exercise code-named ‘Golden Dawn’ in the South East. Simon Ekpa, a self-styled disciple of the leader of the outlawed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, berated the governors in a tweet via his Twitter page on Tuesday. Naija News recalls the Nigerian Army had launched the operation in Anambra State targeted at flushing out criminal elements in the southeast state.

item.title: Uche Maduagwu Reacts As Ruth Kadiri Slams Tinubu Over 'Involvement In Owo Church Attack'
item.description: Controversial Nollywood actor, Uche Maduagwu has slammed actress Ruth Kadiri for calling out presidential aspirant, Bola Ahmed Tinubu on his alleged involvement in the Ondo Catholic church massacre. This comes after the actress via her Instagram crucified the presidential aspirantBola Ahmed Tinubu following his condolence visit to Ondo state where many innocent Catholic worshippers were killed. Recall, that the APC Chieftain had pledged N75million to the victims of the Owo attack.

item.title: Comic Talks of Estranged Relationship
item.description: Who Are Gary Owen's Children? Comedian Has Estranged Relationship With His Older KidsThe stand-up comedian recently welcomed twins. He's also the father to his estranged children, Austin and Kennedy. By Sarah KesterMay 9 2024, Published 2:58 p.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesGary Owen is a father again. In May 2024, the stand-up comedian shared the news that he'd quietly welcomed nine-month-old twins. During an appearance on Shannon Sharpe’s podcast, Club Shay Shay, he shared that his new additions don’t have a relationship with his estranged children, Austin and Kennedy.

item.title: Dr Disrespect Is Back to Online Streaming but Not on Twitch
item.description: We still don’t know exactly why Dr Disrespect was banned from Twitch (he doesn’t either), but he’s back to online streaming, now on YouTube Live. Source: YouTubeVery few streamers have attained the level of notoriety that Herschel "Guy" Beahm IV aka Dr Disrespect has, especially over the past few weeks. During his time as a Twitch streamer, he built a community of more than 4 million followers who watched his streams no matter how out-there they became (and that’s saying something).

item.title: Erin Richards - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: TV actress who portrayed Nancy Reid on the BBC series Being Human and was cast to play Barbara Kean in the FOX series Gotham. As well as being an actress, she has earned credit for her work as a writer and director on various films and television series'. Before Fame She made her big screen debut in the 2005 film Expiry Date, playing the character Luce. Trivia Following her time on Being Human, she went on to star as Molly Hughes in the TV series Breaking In in 2012.

item.title: Kidnapped Imo Monarch, Others Regain Freedom
item.description: The traditional ruler of Umueze Nguru community in Aboh Mbaise Local Government Area of Imo State, Eze Charles Iroegbu, his cabinet chiefs, and palace guards have been released. Naija News learned that the monarch, his five cabinet chiefs, and two palace guards regained their freedom on Saturday, three days after their abduction. Recall that Iroeugbu, owner and Chief Executive Officer of All States Mass Transit, alongside seven others were kidnapped after attending a traditional wedding ceremony in the Ehime Mbano LGA of the state on Wednesday.

item.title: Mwanamke Bomet anaswa kwenye video akisinzia huku akipiga makofi DP Ruto akitoa hotuba
item.description: Mwanamke mmoja amesisimua mitandao ya kijamii baada ya kuonekana kwenye video akisinzia wakati Naibu Rais William Ruto alipokuwa akitoa hotuba yake kwenye hafla moja kule Bomet Ni kawaida kwa mtu kusinzia hasa akiwa kwenye mkutano unaochosha lakini mama huyo aliyesinzia mbele ya Naibu wa Rais amewashangaza wengi. Habari Nyingine : Watafiti wapata dawa ya virusi vya Ukimwi, hatua moja imesalia Mwanamke huyo ambaye alikuwa miongoni mwa wananchi waliokuwa wamemtembelea Naibu Rais nyumbani kwake Sugoi kaunti ya Bomet alionekana kuwa mchovu huku akijaribu kupambana na pepo la usingizi lakini lililomuandama.

item.title: Alicia von Rittberg - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: German actress who gained international fame in 2014 for her role as Emma in the World War II film Fury. In her home country, she is known for her acclaimed work in films like 2011's Hindenburg and 2012's Barbara. Before Fame She was born in Munich and began her screen acting career in the role of Jill in the television movie Die Lawine in 2007. Trivia She won the Young Artist Award at the 2013 Bavarian TV Awards for her performance in the television movie Und Alle Haben Geschwiegen.

item.title: NDA Attack: You Are Incompetent
item.description: The alleged incompetence of President Muhammadu Buhari in managing the country has been blamed for the general insecurity plaguing Nigeria. This submission was made by the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in the wake of the attack by bandit terrorists on the Nigerian Defence Academy (NDA) on Tuesday morning. It will be recalled that unknown gunmen in the early hours of Tuesday, breached the security of the NDA, killed two military officers and escaped into the bush with another abducted officer.

item.title: Oa mke mwingine na umtambulishe kwa Wakenya Uhuru ashawishiwa
item.description: -Rais Uhuru Kenyatta ameombwa kumuoa mke mwingine ili kubadili dhana ya wanawake kuhusu wanamume kuoa wake wengi -Wanawake wengi wamepinga wazo hilo -Mjadala wa wanaume kuoa wake wengi ulianza 2014 lakini ukafufuliwa tena na mwakilishi wa wanawake wa kaunti ya Kiambu Gathoni wa Muchomba Mjadala wa wanaume kuwaoa wake wengi umechukua mkondo mwingine baada ya Rais Uhuru Kenyatta kutakiwa kuchukua hatua itakayobadilisha dhana kuhusu wanaume kuwaoa wake wengi. Mwakilishi wa wanawake wa kaunti ya Mombasa Asha Hussein Jumanne, Aprili 10 alimtaka Rais Kenyatta kuoa mke wa pili kama ishara kuwa anaunga mkono wanaume kuwaoa wake wengi.

item.title: Rustu Recber: Legendary Turkey goalkeeper hospitalized after contracting coronavirus
item.description: - Rustu Recber has tested positive for deadly coronavirus and has been rushed to the hospital - The 46-year-old helped Turkey win the bronze medal at the 2002 World Cup - Recber was named in the tournament's all-star team Legendary Turkey goalkeeper Rustu Recber has tested positive for coronavirus, his wife has confirmed. Recber, who featured for top clubs like Barcelona, Fenerbahce and Besiktas, is Turkey's all-time record holder for appearances, earning 120 caps over an 18-year international career.

item.title: APC Will Fail In Lagos State PDP Spokesman
item.description: The State Publicity Secretary of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Barrister Taofeek Gani in this interview with OLAOLU OLADIPO declares that the days of the All Progressive Congress (APC) are numbered in Lagos. The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has released the election timetable, what is the reaction of the Lagos PDP to the document? . How prepare is your party? To us, the timetable as prevented by INEC is in tandem with the provisions of the electoral Act.

item.title: Craig Lowndes - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: One of Australia's top V8 Supercar drivers, he became a multi-time champion in V8 Supercars and the Bathurst 1000. Before Fame Beginning racing go-karts at the age of 9, he turned to cars starting with the 1991 Motorcraft Formula Ford 'Driver to Europe' Series, and then joined the Holden Racing Team. Trivia He won his first of multiple Sandown 500s in 1996 and won the Queensland 500 in 2000. Family Life He his his wife Nat separated in 2011, after 14 years of marriage.

item.title: DJ Jimmy Jatt Survives Battle With Kidney Disease
item.description: Veteran Nigerian disc jockey, Oluwaforijimi Adewale Amu better known as DJ Jimmy Jatt, has undergone a successful kidney transplant after battling the disease. Naija News reports that Nigerian entertainer opened up via his Instagram on Friday, September, 16th that he had a kidney transplant. According to DJ Jimmy Jatt, September 14th made it six months since he had the transplant, which was done in Lagos, Nigeria, after choosing to come down from the United States.

item.title: Joe Laurinaitis - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: 2011 WWE Hall of Fame inductee who was a three-time tag team champion under the ring name Road Warrior Animal. Before Fame He made his debut as half of the Road Warriors duo in 1986, competing for the National Wrestling Alliance. Trivia He authored his autobiography in 2011, entitled The Road Warriors: Danger, Death, and the Rush of Wrestling. Family Life He had two children, James and Jessica, with bodybuilder and wife Julie Laurinaitis.

item.title: Sokoto Assembly Speaker Dumps APC For PDP
item.description: The Speaker of the Sokoto State House of Assembly, Hon. Aminu Muhamad Achida has defected from the All Progressives Congress (APC) to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Naija News understands the Speaker announced his defection during the house plenary on Thursday. He disclosed that the State Governor, Aminu Tambuwal played a huge role in his decision to dump the APC for the PDP. Similarly, a member of the state House of Assembly representing Wammako 2Constituemcy, Murtala Bello Maigona has also dumped the APC for the PDP.

item.title: Atiku, Obi Attend NBA Conference In Lagos
item.description: The Annual General Conference of the Nigerian Bar Association (NBA) has kicked off with the Presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, and Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi, in attendance. Naija News reports that literary icon and playwright, Chimamanda Adichie, is also attending the opening ceremony of the conference at the Eko Hotels and Suites in Lagos. According to the NBA’s Technical Committee on Conference Planning (TCCP), Adichie will deliver the keynote speech at the event.

item.title: BBI Was Stopped by Satan, Not God, Raila Odinga Chides William Ruto
item.description: Raila Odinga said BBI was good a document that meant well for all Kenyans He argued counties were going to get more resources for infrastructure development and economic growthRaila's sentiment came barely weeks after Deputy President William Ruto attributed the downfall of the Bill to God's interventionOrange Democratic Party leader Raila Odinga has slammed those purporting that God stopped the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) bill because it was a bad document.

item.title: Clare Siobhn - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Avid Sims gamer and social media star most popular on YouTube with over 1.9 million subscribers. She has worked as the social manager for Xbox EMEA. Before Fame She was born in Leeds, England. Trivia She gained popularity on Instagram with more than 320,000 followers, on Instagram she's posted several selfie pics of her dog Eevee. Family Life She has a brother named Dane. She began dating fellow YouTube gamer Alastair Aiken in 2015. She and Aiken got engaged in 2019 and wed two years later.

item.title: Macaulay Culkin and Brenda Song Named Their First Child After Macaulay's Sister
item.description: Macaulay Culkin's Dakota sister died in a car accident in 2008, and now, her brother has named his first child with Brenda Song after her. Source: Getty ImagesAlthough he's not as in the public eye as he once was, Macaulay Culkin and his siblings remain public figures, Just recently, news broke that Macaulay is now a father. Macaulay, who is himself one of eight children, named his first child with long-time girlfriend Brenda Song after his sister Dakota.

item.title: Man Hilariously Narrates Sneaking into the Kitchen at Night after Refusing to Eat Wife's Food
item.description: A Nigerian man, Dr Ayeni, said he could not hold a grudge against his wife for long after he had refused to eatHungry, the man snuck into the kitchen with the plan to eat the food without letting his partner know After numerous attempts, he threw caution to the wind and feasted on the food, saying he could not die of hungerA Nigerian doctor in the UK, Dr Ayeni, has narrated he refused to eat his wife's food because he was angry.

item.title: Frank Bonner - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Director of the series, City Guys and is also known as Herb Tarlek on WKRP in Cincinnati. Before Fame He made his acting debut in the 1970 film, Equinox. Trivia He has also had recurring roles in Just the Ten of Us and Saved by the Bell: The New Class. Family Life He got married to his fifth wife, Gayle Hardage, in 2006. Associated With He co-starred in The New WKRP in Cincinnati with Gordon Jump in the early 1990s.

item.description: - Uhuru said those already in school will continue with their studies uninterrupted even as the rest wait for January next year - Grade Four, Class Eight and Form learners re-joined school in October 2020 despite COVID-19 fears - Several schools have been closed after they reported positive coronavirus cases with some teachers dying as a result - CS Magoha has faced backlash and pressure to close down schools following the surge

item.title: Zara Was 'Killed' By Family Ignorance, Not By Disease - Singer's Friend, Yemisi Ilo
item.description: A friend of late singer Zara, Yemisi Ilo, who also has Multiple Sclerosis (MS) stated that Zara's death is on the hands of her family. Ilo, a creative consultant with many years experience in books/magazine publishing, film production, said she spoke with Zara on Tuesday. And Zara told Ilo that family gave her 'Agbo' to drink and that it was killing her. According to Ilo, it was her exact words.

item.title: Breaking: Gunmen kill Ahmed Gulak, former President Jonathans ex-political adviser
item.description: - Special Adviser Political to President Goodluck Jonathan, Ahmed Gulak, has been murdered - The aide was killed in Owerri by unknown gunmen - He was returning from Abuja when the sad incident occurred PAY ATTENTION: Join Legit.ng Telegram channel! Never miss important updates! Some unknown gunmen have ended the life of former Special Adviser (Politics) to President Goodluck Jonathan, Ahmed Gulak. Gulak was gunned down in Imo state when he was on his way to Abuja from Owerri.

item.title: GloZell Green - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Famous for viral YouTube videos such as "My Push Up Bra Will Help Me Get My Man" and "Cinnamon Challenge," this comedian and wildly popular internet personality has over 4.6 million YouTube subscribers. She had the honor of interviewing US President Barack Obama in January 2015, alongside fellow YouTubers Bethany Mota and Hank Green. Before Fame After graduating from the University of Florida with a bachelor's degree in musical theatre, she moved to Los Angeles, California and became a member of a sketch comedy troupe called The Groundlings.

item.title: I Will Lead From The Front In Boko Haram War- Buhari
item.description: The All Progressive Congress (APC) presidential candidate, General Muhammadu Buhari has vowed to personally “lead from the front” in the war against the Islamist sect, Boko Haram if voted in as the country’s president in March 28 presidential poll. The presidential aspirant gave the pledge on Thursday while delivering a speech at the Chatham House international affairs institute in London, Vanguard reports. item.description: Season 4 of 'Greenhouse Academy' was full of twists and turns. But will there be a Season 5? Keep reading to find out if your fave show will return. Source: NetflixGreenhouse Academy has been a turbulent ride since its premiere, and Season 4 is no exception. The teen drama follows three students from working-class backgrounds who win a scholarship to an elite boarding school and must learn to navigate the rivalries and romances that are part of the Greenhouse Academy life.

item.title: Aghasadyg Garaybeyli - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: 20th-century Azerbaijan actor who starred in films from the 1920s to the 1980s. These include Under the Scorching Sun, Life is Beautiful, Brother! and The Boys of Our Streets. Before Fame He started acting in theater productions in 1917 and had his first film role in 1924's The Maiden Tower. Trivia He was named a People's Artist of Azerbaijan in 1940. Family Life He was raised by a foster family after his parents died when he was a child.

item.description: Gloria Estefan Spoke to Her Deceased Mom via a Medium on 'Red Table Talk' (EXCLUSIVE CLIP)By Chris BarillaOct. 27 2021, Published 3:00 p.m. ET Source: Facebook WatchAfter decades of work in the music industry, Gloria Estefan is undoubtedly a household name. The star has been the recipient of multiple Grammys and Billboard awards — and even the Presidential Medal of Freedom — and she has released countless chart-topping hits to boot.

item.title: Who is Victoria Rubadiri? Husband, biography, age, salary
item.description: Victoria Rubadiri is a Kenyan news anchor, show host, and media personality. She presents news on Citizen TV, Kenya's most-watched TV station. Victoria and Citizen TV colleague Waihiga Mwaura won a prestigious BBC award in 2020. Victoria Rubadiri is a household name in East Africa and one of the highest-paid journalists in the region. The lady believes in women's empowerment and second chances. She once told her story on air to inspire teenage mothers.

item.title: Wike Speaks On Dumping PDP
item.description: Governor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State has stated that he has no plans to leave the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) due to the crisis rocking the party. Wike made this known to journalists on Friday at the Port Harcourt International Airport in the Rivers State capital, shortly after he returned from Spain. The governor said he decided to keep quiet concerning the situation in the PDP because he has so much love for the opposition party.

item.title: Afenifere Leader Discloses Reason For Backing Peter Obi
item.description: Leader of Afenifere, a pan-Yoruba socio-political organisation, Ayo Adebanjo has said that Labour Party presidential candidate,  Peter Obi, shares the same values with him. Recall that Adebanjo and the leadership of Southern and Middle Belt Forum (SMBLF) had on Tuesday met with the LP presidential flagbearer. Speaking on the meeting with the former governor of Anambra in an interview on Channels TV, Adebanjo said that Obi believes in the restructuring of the nation and is also fighting for oppressed Nigerians.

item.title: Asanda Jezile - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Competitor and finalist on Britain's Got Talent in 2013 whose renditions of Beyoncé's "Halo" and "If I Were a Boy" helped her advance late into competition. Before Fame She auditioned with the song "Diamonds" by Rihanna. Her performance was both praised and ridiculed as the song contained age-sensitive lyrical content. Trivia She was cast in the role of Tallulah in a stage production of Bugsy Malone. After her appearance on Britain's Got Talent in 2013, she auditioned for a Disney movie.

item.title: Buhari, Tinubu, Shettima Wives To Inaugurate Campaign Team, Name Spokespersons
item.description: Barring any last-minute change, the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) will on Monday inaugurate its Women Presidential Campaign team. Naija News reports that the APC Women campaign team will on Monday name its campaign spokesperson. According to the organizing committee of the Tinubu-Shettima Women Presidential Campaign Team, the formal inauguration of its various committee members will also hold on the same day. Speaking to The PUNCH, a source said that the inauguration of the 944-member team will signal the official kick-off of the party’s campaign, adding that the women’s team will enjoy a degree of autonomy to arrange and organize its own programmes at the national, zonal, and state levels.

item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has not sanctioned, neither is he in support of any plan to declare a state of emergency in Anambra State. As earlier reported by Naija News, the two leaders met on Thursday morning and chief among their discussions was the threat made by the Attorney-General of the Federation (AGF) and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami that a state of emergency may be declared on Anambra by the federal government.

item.description: Recently sacked Minister of Power, Sale Mamman, has penned an emotional and appreciation note to President Muhammadu Buhari following his sack. Naija News reports that Buhari had sacked Mamman and the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, Sabi Nanono, on Wednesday. item.title: Things You Should Know About Nigerias Kemi Badenoch Who Wants To Become UKs Prime Minister
item.description: A Nigerian-born British politician, Kemi Badenoch has declared her aspiration to succeed Boris Johnson as the next leader of the Conservative Party and British Prime Minister. The former Equalities Minister, Badenoch declared her candidacy while stating her desire for a limited government and her intention to speak the truth. In a joint statement with fellow Ministers Alex Burghart, Neil O’Brien, Lee Rowley, and Julia Lopez last Wednesday, Badenoch announced her resignation from the government, citing Johnson’s handling of the Chris Pincher scandal.

item.title: 14 Classic Valentine Messages To Send To Your Val Today, February 14, 2022
item.description: Today is not just the 14th Day of the month of February but it also marks the remarkable day of “love” as “Valentine‘s Day” which is celebrated February 14 annually is today. Naija News understands that “Valentine’s Day” is celebrated worldwide February 14 annually. Valentine’s Day originated as a Western Christian feast day honouring one or two early saints named Valentinus. The Day is recognized as a significant cultural, religious, and commercial celebration of romance and romantic love in many regions around the world, although it is not a public holiday in any country.

item.title: Latest Political News In Nigeria For Today, Friday, 12th August, 2022
item.description: Welcome to the round-up of the latest political news in Nigeria, political gist, highlights of political events, and happenings in Nigeria for today Friday, 12th August 2022. Read all the major political news, political event highlights, and happenings in Nigeria for today on a single page right here. Wike Denies Suit Seeking Atiku, Tambuwal’s Disqualification Governor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State has denied filing a suit seeking the immediate removal of Atiku Abubakar as the presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in next year’s general election.

item.title: Aspirant Drags APC To Court Over Irregularities During Election
item.description: An aspirant for the Nasarawa/Toto Federal Constituency on the platform of the All Progressives Congress, Mohammed Al-Basir has dragged the party to court over the recently conducted primary election. Naija News reports that the aspirant also dragged the House of Representatives member, Ari Abdulmumuni who was declared the winner of the election held on May 29, 2022. Speaking to journalists on Wednesday after the case was adjourned, counsel to the plaintiff, Mathew Bukaa, insisted that his client won the election.

item.title: BREAKING: ASUU Suspends Nationwide Strike
item.description: This was made known in a press conference on Wednesday morning by the President of ASUU, Professor Biodun Ogunyemi. The suspension of the nine-month-old strike would take effect from 12:00 am Thursday, December 24, 2020. Speaking at the press conference, Ogunyemi warned that if the federal government refuses to fulfil its own part of the agreement they will resume the strike without notice. Recall that the President Muhammadu Buhari-led government on Tuesday disclosed that the prolonged strike by ASUU would soon come to an end.

item.title: Police officer arrested for stealing materials from construction site in Murang'a
item.description: An Administration Police officer and three other civilians are set to appear in court on Monday, April 8, in connection to alleged theft of building materials at a construction site in Murang'a county. The four suspects are said to have stolen the items worth KSh 3 million from a Chinese firm constructing the Northern Water Collector Tunnel in Kigumo Sub-county on three separate dates. item.title: Tinubu-Atiku Meeting: Politicians Are Friends, Dont Die For Them
item.description: Eligible voters and supporters of flagbearers in the 2023 general elections have been advised by the Catholic Bishop of Sokoto Diocese, Matthew Kukah not to kill themselves over politicians. Kukah noted that politicians in the country are friends contesting for their share of the national cake. The cleric stated this while speaking on Channels TV on Tuesday. Recall that the presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu, and the flagbearer of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, on Monday met at the private wing of the Nnamdi Azikwe International Airport in Abuja.

item.title: Another Lady Accuses BRT Driver Of Attempted Rape
item.description: A medical doctor identified as Onyinyechi Anoke has revealed how BRT driver, Andrew Nice, who has been linked to the death of Oluwabamise Ayanwole, attempted to rape her. Anoke’s account makes it the second lady to accuse Nice who was remanded in prison on Friday over the death of Bamise. The Medical doctor in an interview with Punch revealed that Nice attempted to rape her, one month after he allegedly raped a former salesgirl in Lagos.

Military Onslaught: Bandits Fleeing From Zamfara To Katsina
item.description: The ongoing military onslaught in Zamfara State is forcing bandits previously operating in the area to flee to communities in Katsina State. The district head of Batsari in Katsina State, Alhaji Tukur Mu’azu made the submission, noting that the bandits are attempting to resettle in communities within Batsari Local Government Area of Katsina after escaping military firepower in Zamfara. The royal father specifically identified Yaso Duba, Sabon-garin Dunburawa, Baking – Ragi, and Labor as communities where the bandits are now seeking refuge from the military onslaught after they were dislodged from the forests of Zamfara State.

item.title: The Only Thing That Would Have Made Me Compete Diana Edobor
item.description: Former Big Brother Naija housemate, Diana Edobor, has announced that she has no interest in participating in the All Star edition of the reality TV show this month. She explained that the only reason she would return to the Big Brother House was if BBN S1 housemate and host of the subsequent editions, Ebuka Obi-Uchendu was also competing for the N120 million cash prize. Edobor made the revelation via her official Twitter handle on Friday.

item.title: APC Campaign Council Speaks On Tinubu's Investment In Nigeria
item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC) Presidential Campaign Council has said it is not concerned whether the party’s presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu, has investments in any company in Nigeria. The Director of Strategic Communication of the council, Dele Alake, said this during an Interview on Channels Television, on Sunday night, Naija News reports. Ahead of the 2023 presidential election, the source of Tinubu’s wealth and his investments have again come under public scrutiny.

item.title: Amazon's 'Panic' Stars Talk Filming Locations, Season 2 (EXCLUSIVE)
item.description: Olivia Welch and Jessica Sula Talk Filming On-Location for Amazon's YA Series 'Panic' (EXCLUSIVE)By Gabrielle BernardiniPublished May 28 2021, 5:45 p.m. ET Source: AmazonTry not to panic. Amazon's latest angsty teen series Panic follows a group of high school seniors living in the small town of Carp, Texas. To escape their unfortunate surroundings, the graduating class pulls together all of their money every year to help one lucky (and brave) individual win the cash prize jackpot.

item.title: Erik Ten Hag Buys Some Time Via Man United's Draw With Liverpool
item.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag would be leaving Anfield Stadium with a temporary sigh of relief after his team managed to grab an unexpected draw with Liverpool. After leading Manchester United to finish bottom of their Champions League group, most football enthusiasts predicted that the owners of the Red Devils might sack Erik ten Hag if he loses to Liverpool today, December 17. Liverpool went into the Premier League game as one of the major title contenders after spending last week on top of the table.

item.title: Jang Says Babangida Lied, Declares PDP Governors Never Worked Against Jonathan
item.description: Former Plateau State Governor, Jonah Jang has denied an allegation that northern governors of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) worked against the second-term bid of former President Goodluck Jonathan in 2015. Jang was responding to an allegation levelled by former Niger State Governor, Babangida Aliyu who claimed that the Northern PDP governors worked against Jonathan’s re-election bid because he reneged on an agreement not to seek a second term. It will be recalled as earlier reported by Naija News that Aliyu on Friday while reacting to his suspension by the PDP in Chachanga Local Government Area of Niger, said the North would have lost out completely if Jonathan got reelected.

item.title: Rally In Lagos: APC Warns Pro-Biafra Activists
item.description: The Lagos state chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) has issued a warning to those activists planning to organize mass demonstration in Lagos under the aegis of the Movement for the Actualisation of Sovereign State of Biafra and the Independent People of Biafra (IPOB). PM News reports that the warning was contained in a statement made by Joe Igbokwe, the Lagos state publicity secretary of the APC. Igbokwe stressed that the state would not allow politically sponsored hoodlums masquerading as pro-Biafran protesters or any other group to plunge Lagos into crisis.

item.title: Ruger - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Singer known for tracks like "Dior," "Bounce" and "Snapchat." His song "Asiwaju" has accumulated more than 26 million streams on Spotify. He has amassed more than 2.4 million followers on his rugerofficial Instagram account. Before Fame He was signed to a label called D'Prince's Jonzing World Records. Trivia In February 2022, he performed at a high-profile concert in Uganda. The concert went ahead after being canceled by police who said organizers failed to meet basic security and safety standards.

item.title: Billions Approved For Weapons Under Buhari Missing
item.description: The national Security Adviser, Maj-Gen Babagana Munguno, on Friday disclosed that billions of naira approved by president Muhammadu Buhari for purchase of weapons can not be accounted for. According to Munguno, the new Service Chiefs assumed office and could not access weapons their predecessors ought to have purchased. The former service chiefs are: ex-Chief of Defence Staff, Abayomi Olonisakin; former Chief of Army Staff; Tukur Buratai, former Chief of Naval Staff; Ibok-Ete Ekwe Ibas; and former Chief of Air Staff, Sadique Abubakar.

item.title: Fans Think the Sabrina Carpenter and David Dobrik Dating Rumors Are Nonsense but Are They?
item.description: Singer Sabrina Carpenter and influencer David Dobrik have been spotted hanging out together on two separate occasions. Could they possibly be dating? item.title: Victor Osimhen Alone Is Not Enough For Chelsea
item.description: Former Chelsea and Arsenal defender, William Gallas, has argued that Super Eagles of Nigeria forward, Victor Osimhen alone cannot solve the problem at the Stamford Bridge-based club. Victor Osimhen is expected to depart his Italian Serie A club, Napoli, next summer if a club can pay between €110 million to €130 million for his services. The said amounts are the estimated value of the release clause in his contract with Napoli which is expected to expire on June 30, 2026.

item.title: 2023: Emefiele Interested In Presidential Race
item.description: The lawyers to the Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria, Godwin Emefiele, Mike Ozekhome’s chamber on Monday disclosed that his client has presidential ambition in the 2023 race. A lawyer from the chamber, Maliki Sylvanus, revealed this in an affidavit in support of Emefiele’s originating summons filed before a Federal High Court, Abuja Division and marked FHC/ABJ/CS/610/2022. The affidavit tendered before the court is contrary to Emefiele’s statement on Friday, claiming to be waiting on God on the next decision to make.
