item.description: Conan O'Brien's late-night talk show 'Conan' is now over, and he will be making the switch to HBO Max from TBS. But what show is replacing his? Source: Getty ImagesNow that the late-night show has aired its last episode, there's a Conan-shaped hole in fans' hearts. Although talks about show ending have been taking place for years and were even confirmed in 2020, people still need something to watch. So just like Conan replaced David Letterman back in 1993 and then Jay Leno over a decade later, it's time for Conan to see the same fate.

item.title: Tom Hardy - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actor who played Bane in The Dark Knight Rises and went on to star as the title character in Marvel's Venom. He has also played prominent roles in the films Bronson, Warrior, Star Trek Nemesis and the Oscar-winning films Mad Max: Fury Road and The Revenant. Before Fame He appeared in the HBO series Band of Brothers and had his first film role in the dramatic war film Black Hawk Down. Trivia His performance as Skank in a 2003 stage production of In Arabia We'd All Be Kings earned him a Laurence Olivier Award for Most Promising Newcomer.

In its final few episodes, Steve, who was introduced in the first part of Season 2, becomes a significant figure in Anna and Maya’s lives.

item.title: Okorocha Declares Interest In 2023 Presidency
item.description: Former Imo State Governor and current Imo West Senator, Rochas Okorocha has openly declared his intention to join the 2023 presidential race. The lawmaker said he wants to contest the presidency on the platform of the All Progressives Congress (APC). Naija News reports Okorocha stated this in a letter read on Wednesday during plenary by Senate President Ahmad Lawan. He added that he would officially declare his ambition for the 2023 presidency at a world press conference scheduled for Monday 31st January 2022.

item.title: Raila Odinga Says High Court Ruling on BBI Disappointing, Appeal Is Inevitable
item.description: - An attempt by Raila Odinga and President Uhuru to amend the Constitution of Kenya suffered a setback after a five-judge High Court bench nullified the process - The ODM leader expressed his disappointment with the bench's decision but indicated the intention to appeal the judgment - He also called on members of the public and politicians who the outcome of the court may have aggrieved to desist from attacking the judges

item.title: Woman Starts Fight at Red Lobster After Waiting 3 Hours for Food
'Tragedy' Hits Tonto Dikeh's Former Lover Kpokpogri As His Multi Million Naira Mansion Gets Demolish
item.description: All is not well with a former lover of Actress, Tonto Dikeh turn foe, Kpokpogri after the FCDA (Federal Capital Development Authority), demolished one of his properties without prior notice. Naija News reports that the aspiring politician via his Insta story on Saturday narrates how some officers of FCDA stormed his property in the wee hours of the morning without notice and began to destroy his gate and fence. Kpokpogri noted that the FCDA men took him unawares as he has not done anything illegal that would lead the agency to cause such havoc on his property.

item.title: IGP Reacts To Killing Of Lagos Lawyer, Bolanle Raheem
item.description: The Inspector-General of Police, Usman Alkali Baba has described the Christmas day killing of a Lagos lawyer, Bolanle Raheem as sad and unfortunate. The IGP in a statement on Monday released by the Force Public Relations Officer, Olumuyiwa Adejobi said a speedy investigation into the matter has been ordered. He also commiserated with the family, friends, and colleagues of the slain lawyer and assured that justice will be served as the officers responsible for the unprofessional act have been arrested.

Habari kuhusu ajali hiyo imeushtua ulimwengu mzima baada ya kubainika kwamba abiria wote kutoka mataifa 35 waliangamia. Habari Nyingine : Ruto aambiwa kufika mbele ya DCI kuchunguzwa kuhusu kashfa ya KSh 21 bilioni ya mabwawa Maswali mengie yameibuka kuhusu kilichosababisha ajali ya ndege aina ya Boeing 737 Max-8, iliyoundwa kwa ustadi mkubwa na utaalamu wa kiusalama.

item.description: - Eliud Owalo alisema kikosi hicho kitaongoza kampeni za urais za Ruto katika ngome ya Raila kaunti ya Siaya - Wanachama wa kikosi hicho walichaguliwa kwa umakinifu mkubwa kutoka kwa vikundi vya vijana, wanawake, walemavu, dini, wazee na vile vile watalaam wa maoni - Kikosi hicho cha Ruto kitaongozwa na mwenyekiti Pamela Ongoma naye makamu mwenyekiti atakuwa mwanachama wa Baraza la Wazee wa Luo Tobias Achando Aliyekuwa msaidizi wa kibinafsi kinara wa ODM Raila Odinga Eliud Owalo sasa ameanza rasmi kueneza injili ya Naibu Rais William Ruto Nyanza kwenye hatua ambayo huenda ikatikisa nyavu za siasa.

item.title: 'Why You Stubborn Like This'
item.description: Popular Nollywood actress  Nkechi Blessing has reacted after her colleague boldly disobeyed her first wife Funsho Adeoti. Recall that Mercy Aigbe who stepped out in style for her colleague, Ini Edo’s 40th birthday party had shared some pictures and video of herself in Kazim Adeoti’s house. Reacting to the photos, Funsho demanded that she take it down and gave the actress and her husband 12 hours to do the needful.

item.title: "I Had a Predisposition for Instant Gratification," Says Jordan Belfort
item.description: What happened to Jordan Belfort? The stockbroker devoted his thirties to the pursuit of a hedonistic lifestyle. So, what brought about his demise? Source: GettyJordan Belfort's first memoir, titled The Wolf of Wall Street, came out in September 2007 — and it was an instant hit. In it, the former stockbroker opened up about his wild adventures for the first time, offering new details about his life spent making heaps and heaps of money, going on mad helicopter rides, and getting high on just about every illegal substance sold on the streets of New York.

item.title: Atiku Cuts Down Delegation To Meet Wike's Team
item.description: The presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, has reportedly cut down to three his delegation to meet with Governor Nyesom Wike and his allies over the crisis rocking the opposition party. Recall that the PDP plunged into crisis after Atiku overlooked Wike and picked Governor Ifeanyi Okowa of Delta State as his running mate for the presidential election. The Rivers governor, who came second in the party’s presidential primary, has refused to openly back the presidential ambition of Atiku.

item.title: How Pantami, Muslim Leaders Allegedly Plotted To "Wipe Away Christians" From North
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari’s Minister of Communications and Digital Economy, Dr. Isa Pantami allegedly plotted with some Muslim leaders to violently wipe away Christians from northern parts of Nigeria. According to the PeoplesGazette, Pantami chaired a July 13, 2010, meeting of Jama’atu Nasril Islam (JNI), where it was agreed that Christians should be prohibited from building churches in the city centre across the North. The JNI led by the Minister concluded that Christians should only build churches around designated corners away from the cities.

item.title: Isaac Newton - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Physicist and mathematician who became one of the most influential scientists of all time, formulating the three basic laws of motion and the law of universal gravitation. He built the first practical reflecting telescope and his work helped Enlightenment thinkers rebel against Church theology.  Before Fame His mother wanted him to be a farmer, but the headmaster of King's School, Henry Stokes, convinced her to let him complete his education.

item.title: Ekweremadu's Daughter Needed A Kidney- Rufai
item.description: Popular Nigerian Journalist, Oseni Rufai has given some insight into the organ harvesting case facing Ike Ekweremadu and his wife, Beatrice. Naija News reports that Ekweremadu and his wife were arrested in London by the Specialist Crime Team of the UK Metropolitan Police. In a statement on Thursday, the Metropolitan Police confirmed that the pair conspired to facilitate the travel of a child to the county in order to harvest the minor’s organ.

item.title: Manchester Heads To FA Cup Quarter Finals After 1-0 Win Against West Ham
item.description: An extra minutes goal from Scottish professional footballer, Scott Francis McTominay on Tuesday night, February saw Manchester United to FA Cup quarter-finals, Naija News reports. The 24-year-old central midfielder who came from the bench netted a 97 minutes goal for the Red Devils to send David Moyes‘s side out of the competition. Naija News understands that the two English Premier League club played a goalless 90 minutes game last night until a goal came in for the Red Devils in the extra-time.

item.title: When Will the Nintendo Switch OLED Be Back in Stock? How to Secure One
item.description: Here's How to Secure the Nintendo Switch OLEDBy Sara BelcherPublished Oct. 28 2021, 8:42 p.m. ET Source: NintendoDespite the fact that for much of the 2020 lockdown, both the Nintendo Switch and the Nintendo Switch Lite were difficult to find in stores, Nintendo decided to release a new, updated version of the console this year: the Nintendo Switch OLED. This new model features a few upgraded specs, including increased storage, a bigger screen size, and a wider kickstand — and is also frequently sold out at most retailers.

President Buhari Presides Over FEC Meeting
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Wednesday presided over the weekly Federal Executive Council (FEC) meeting. Naija News reports that the meeting was held at the Council Chambers of the State House, Abuja. The Vice President of Nigeria, Yemi Osinbajo, Chief of Staff to the President, Ibrahim Gambari, and the Secretary to Government of the Federation, Boss Mustapha were physically in attendance. Also at the meeting are the Minister of Justice and Attorney-General of the Federation, Abubakar Malami, the Minister of Finance, Budget and National Planning, Zainab Ahmed, Minister of Water Resources, Suleiman Adamu, Minister of Federal Capital Territory, Mohammed Bello, the Minister for Women Affairs, Pauline Tallen and the Minister of Special Duties, George Akume.

item.title: Court Suspends Buni As Interim National Chairman Of APC
item.description: The Governor of Yobe State, Mai Mala Buni, has been sacked as the Chairman, Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee of the All Progressives Congress. A High Court sitting in Asaba, Delta State on Wednesday restrained the interim chairman and others from parading themselves as members of the party’s CECPC until the determination of a substantive suit before the court. The presiding judge, Justice Onome Marshal Umukoro, in his ruling on Wednesday also stopped the Party’s scheduled LG Congress in Delta State slated for September 4, 2021.

item.title: Tiwa Savage Addresses Leaked Tape Scandal In Fresh Song With Asake
item.description: Nigerian sensational female singer, Tiwa Savage has addressed her leaked tape scandal in a hit single dubbed ‘Loaded’ featuring Afrobeat star, Asake. In the video which was directed by TG Omori, Tiwa who sang mostly in Yoruba revisited her leaked tape, where she noted the scandal cannot ruin her life. “They planned against me, but s3x tape can’t ruin my life,” she sang in Yoruba in the video The 42-year-old mum of one who sang alongside Asake in the video that was released at midnight on Tuesday, November 8 further proceeded to say, “who never f*ck, hands in the air”.

item.title: Anti-Open Grazing Policy Not Working, Give Fulani Herdsmen Something That Works
item.description: Nasarawa State Governor, Abdullahi Sule has told some of his colleagues that the anti-open grazing policy adopted in some states is not realistic. The Governor who observed that the policy is not working but some states are just following the band-wagon effect in signing the law, called on such states to adopt a workable solution. Sule however acknowledged that it is archaic for the Fulani herdsmen to continue open grazing in these modern times, submitted that his administration is looking at embracing the National Livestock Transformation Plan.

item.title: Amotekun Rescues Remaining Three Kidnapped Travellers In Ondo
item.description: Amotekun operatives in Ondo State have rescued all the travellers kidnapped along the Idoani-Ifira Akoko expressway in Akoko South-East Local Government Area of the state on Wednesday. Naija News reports that unknown gunmen attacked an 18-seater bus carrying the travellers from Abuja to Lagos and kidnapped 12 out of the 18 people in the bus. It was gathered the criminals blocked the highway on the bad portion of the road and attacked the bus, forcing it to stop abruptly on the highway.

item.title: 15 well-made slavery movies that you need to watch in 2021
item.description: Slavery has been existing in different societies across the world since time immemorial. Historians and enslaved folk have been documenting the atrocities through various media like books, films, and documentaries. Slavery movies are not always exciting to watch, especially those that are based on a true story. Actual slavery movies elicit intense emotions and feelings. Many of the films are adaptations from books or accounts from slaves that chronicled their journeys.

item.title: Labour Party Releases Peter Obi Presidential Campaign Council [Full List]
item.description: The Nigerian Labour Party on Wednesday unveiled its Obi-Datti Presidential Campaign Council ahead of the 2023 Presidential Election. Naija News reports that 1,234 members were named for Obi-Datti Presidential Campaign Organisation. Mohammed Zarewa was named as the Chairman, while the Director General of the Peter Obi Campaign Organisation, Dr. Doyin Okupe, retained his position as DG of the PCC. This was made public by the National Organising Secretary, Clement Ojukwu, at a Pre-Campaign Press Conference, in Abuja, on Wednesday.

item.title: State Governors Are The Cause Of Rising Poverty Level
item.description: The Federal Government has blamed the state government for being the cause of the rising poverty level in the country. Naija News reports that Minister of State for Budget and National Planning, Clement Agba made this allegation in Abuja on Wednesday after the week’s Federal Executive Council (FEC) meeting presided over by President Muhammadu Buhari at the Presidential Villa. According to him, the surge in the poverty level in the country is because state governments have failed to contribute their quota of development responsibilities to the grassroots where the major production activities take place.

item.title: FG Tells Nigerians Why They've Been Experiencing Poor Electricity Supply
item.description: The Nigerian government has explained the epileptic power supply been experienced in the country is a result of reduced water supply to the dams caused by the dry season. The Minister of Power, Abubakar Aliyu gave the update on Thursday during the ministerial press briefing in Abuja organized by the presidential media team. He said this has led to massive load sheddings across various locations in the country including the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja.

item.title: Police Take Over APC Secretariat As Buni Inaugurates State Executives
item.description: The National Secretariat of the All Progressives Congress in Abuja has been taken over by operatives of the Nigeria Police Force. It was gathered that the ruling party deployed the security operatives to forestall the breakdown of law and order. The chairman of the Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) and Governor of Yobe State, Mai Mala Buni is expected to inaugurate the new executive.

item.title: Miyetti Allahs Leader, Bodejo Detained For National Security, FG Tells Court
item.description: The Federal Government, through the office of the Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice,  Lateef Fagbemi, SAN, has clarified why the arrest and continued detention of the President of Miyetti Allah Kautal Hore, Bello Bodejo, remains imperative. Arrested on January 23, following his involvement in unveiling a vigilante group, Bodejo’s apprehension took place at Miyetti Allah’s office located in the Karu Local Government Area of Nasarawa State. Naija News reports that his arrest by the Defence Intelligence Agency (DIA) sparked a legal tussle, leading to a court application filed by Bodejo to enforce his fundamental right to freedom.

item.title: At Last, FG Agrees To Exclude ASUU From IPPIS
item.description: The Federal Government has finally accepted the demand by the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) that its members should be exempted from the Integrated Payroll and Personnel Information System (IPPIS). Naija News reports that the Federal Government led by President Muhammadu Buhari was made on Friday, November 20, 2020, after weeks of negotiations and foot-dragging on the issue of IPPIS. Apart from the IPPIS, the Federal Government also shifted grounds on a number of issues, including the insistence that all the academic staff of the federal universities must be paid through the IPPIS platform.

item.title: Benzema Linked To Man City After Missing Out On 2021 Ballon d'Or Award
item.description: English Premier League club, Manchester City are reportedly considering signing up Real Madrid’s Karim Benzema. Paris Saint Germain striker, Lionel Messi, was, however, awarded the most prestigious players individual award by the organizers last night, with Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski finishing second. However, reporting on Tuesday morning, La Nacional said Premier League champions, City could move for Benzema when he enters the final year of his contract in June 2022.

item.description: Joe Diffie was a very popular American country music artist, guitarist, and songwriter. item.title: 2023: Why PDP Should Zone National Chairman Position To South West
item.description: The immediate past Deputy National Publicity Secretary of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Diran Odeyemi, has revealed why the party should zone the position of the National Chairman to the South West. Naija News reports that the PDP Presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar, is from Adamawa State in the North East region while his running mate, Governor Ifeanyi Okowa comes from Delta in the South-South region. In a chat with The Punch, Odeyemi stated that the opposition party would need to zone to national chairmanship position to the South West in order to appease the people of the region and win their votes.

item.title: 5 Reasons Why Naira Rate Will Begin To Fall
item.description: Despite Nigeria’s central bank holds official rate of naira atN196.90 against one dollar, the real value of the national currency is falling. See five reasons behind that trend. Despite central bank’s efforts to keep naira’s exchange rate at level of N196.90 for one dollar, which didn’t change from June 11, there are signs that naira is about to start falling soon. In fact, at the parallel market on Friday it was sold for N221 against the dollar already, while a week before one dollar was sold for N220.

item.title: NNPP-LP Alliance: Kwankwaso Is An Ethnic Politician, Obi Should Move On Without Him
item.description: The presidential candidate of the New Nigeria Peoples Party (NNPP) Rabiu Kwankwaso has been labelled as an ethnic politician following the reported breakdown of alliance talks between his party and the Labour Party ahead of the 2023 presidential election. A pan-Igbo sociopolitical pressure organisation, the South East Revival Group (SERG) who made the submission said Kwankwaso possesses an ethnic superiority mindset. The group added that the earlier belief that the former Kano State Governor is a nationalist has been found to be false.

item.title: Bakery Operators Laments As Wheat Production Crashes By 89.44 Per Cent
item.description: The Federal Government in a report has stated that the production of wheat in Nigeria has crashed by 89.44 per cent, dropping from about 350,000 metric tonnes annually to as low as 36,943.8MT. The National Bureau of Statistics in the latest report of Wheat Production Survey disclosed that 36,943.8MT was produced in 13 states. Industry operators disclosed that the rise in the price of bread and pastries in the country is due to the low production of wheat, which is the major material for flour used in baking.

item.description: Governor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State has directed the State Attorney General and Commissioner for Justice to kickstart the prosecution of former Transportation Minister, Rotimi Amaechi; the Rivers State Governorship candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Tonye Cole; Sahara Energy and others. The Rivers governor ordered their prosecution over illegal financial dealings related to the sale of state assets. Recall that the Supreme Court had affirmed the power of the state government to set up a panel of inquiry to probe any financial dealings.

item.title: 'The Masked Singer' Holiday Special Will Pay Tribute to the Late Kirstie Alley
item.description: Kirstie Alley's final TV appearance was on 'The Masked Singer,' and the series will pay tribute to the late actress during its holiday special. Source: FoxKirstie Alley was revealed as the Baby Mammoth on Season 7 of 'The Masked Singer.' American actress Kirstie Alley, best known for her Emmy-winning role as Rebecca Howe in Cheers, died unexpectedly of colon cancer on Dec. 5, 2022. She was 71 years old. According to an official statement released by her children, Kirstie's diagnosis had only recently been discovered.

item.title: Jurgen Klopp Admits Mohamed Salah Is "Suffering"
item.description: Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah is “suffering” this season as a result of the team’s fractured front three, according to the club’s manager Jurgen Klopp. After scoring 23 goals in the 2021-2022 season, Mohamed Salah has seven goals in 19 Premier League games this season. The Egyptian striker took part in three different front lines in each of his previous three games. Salah, Roberto Firmino, and Sadio Mane’s front three helped Liverpool win the Premier League and the Champions League and became known for their aggressive style of play.

item.title: Your Father In The Grave Is Not Happy
item.description: A Crossdresser simply named Cherry has taken to the microblogging platform, Twitter to share the chat his mum sent to him on WhatsApp after seeing his new profile picture. In the viral screenshot shared on Twitter, Cherry’s mother who expressed disappointment to his crossdressing lifestyle, is seen begging him to take the profile picture of him dressed as a girl down, saying his late father would be unhappy about his lifestyle in his grave.

item.title: Atiku Abubakar told BBC why he left the PDP for the APC
item.description: In an interview with the BBC's Newsday programme, Atiku Abubakar denied that he joined the APC so that he could run for president in 2015. He also said he would never come back to the PDP. Atiku Abubakar, a former Vice President of Nigeria, announced his decision to leave the PDP on Sunday. Before that, 37 members of the House of Representatives and 11 Senators left the ruling party for the APC.

item.title: How Courageous Judges Saved Me From Been A Convict
item.description: A former National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Adams Oshiomhole, has revealed how courageous judges saved him from been convicted on numerous occasions. The former NLC Chairman stated this at the weekend while hosting members of the Law Students Association of Nigeria (LAWSON) in his office in Abuja. Oshiomhole, who was invited as guest speaker at the forthcoming National Conference on Rule of Law by LAWSON, said he was a beneficiary of a courageous judiciary.

item.description: Here's Why 'I Can See Your Voice' Wasn't Socially Distanced Last NightBy Jamie LernerPublished Nov. 19 2020, 9:39 p.m. ET Source: FoxFox’s new series I Can See Your Voice was announced as Fox’s newest musical series earlier this year before the COVID-19 pandemic. However, the producers only filmed one episode before COVID-19 hit in March. After that, they were forced into quarantine (like the rest of us), although I Can See Your Voice was one of the first shows to come back with COVID-19 restrictions in place.

item.title: APC Denies Releasing Primary Election Timetable
item.description: The ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) has distanced itself from a purported primary election timetable circulating on social media. Reports emerged on Wednesday that the APC had released the primary election timetable for the 2023 elections in order to meet the June 3, 2022 deadline set by the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC). Addressing reporters at the party’s national secretariat in Abuja on Wednesday, APC spokesman, Barrister Felix Morka, said it has not released any timetable for its primaries.

item.title: Margaret Kenyatta avutia wengi kwa mtindo wake wa mavazi Mashujaa Day
item.description: -Mama wa Taifa Margaret Kenyatta alivutia wengi wakati wa hafla ya mashujaa Bustani ya Uhuru Park -Magaret alizungumziwa sana mitandaoni kutokana na alivyokaa na mtindo wake wa mavazi Siku ya mashujaa 2017 Uhuru Park Ijumaa, Oktoba 20, haikuwa na mambo mengi kutokana na kuwa Rais Uhuru Kenyatta alitoa hotuba ya kawaida tu, na kuwashukuru mashujaa wa taifa. Ingawa siku hiyo haikuwa na visa na visanga, Wakenya walivutiwa na Mama wa Taifa Margret Kenyatta kutokana na mtindo wake wa mavazi.

item.title: Orbih Defeats Obaseki, Appeal Court Favours Orbih's Candidates
item.description: The Court of Appeal sitting in Edo State on Friday nullified the list of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) candidates submitted by the state Governor, Godwin Obaseki. The appellant court ruled in favour of candidates belonging to the Legacy PDP Group led by the National Vice Chairman of the party, Dan Orbih. Following the ruling by Justice Tunde Oyebamiji Awotoye, the candidates that emerged from the primaries of Orbih would be recognised by the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) in 2023.

item.title: Suspended CBN Governor, Emefiele Set To Appear In Court
item.description: The suspended Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Godwin Emefiele is scheduled to make a court appearance on July 25 at the Lagos Division of the Federal High Court. Emefiele has been detained by the Department of State Services (DSS) following allegations levelled against him. He is due to enter his plea before Justice Nicholas Oweibo. Recall that on June 10, DSS operatives visited Emefiele’s residence in Ikoyi, Lagos, a day after his suspension as CBN governor by President Bola Tinubu.

item.title: 2023 Presidency: 'I Will Ensure PDP Dislodges APC At All Cost'
item.description: Governor Samuel Ortom of Benue State has vowed to ensure the incumbent All Progressives Congress, APC government never regains power come 2023, Naija News reports. The Peoples Democratic Party, PDP chieftain who spoke at the party’s national retreat held on Wednesday, November 24 at the NAF conference centre in Abuja said he is determined to end the level of decay Nigerians have witnessed under President Muhammadu Buhari administration. “I am ready to concede anything personal to me to ensure that the PDP dislodges APC in 2023 because of the level of decay we have witnessed in Nigeria under this APC-led Federal Government”, Ortom reiterated in a post on his social media.

October is also home to numerous other national and international holidays, including Leif Erikson Day, Columbus Day, Canada's Thanksgiving and Freethought Day.

item.description: 11 residents of the Igbomotoru community in the Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of Bayelsa State have reportedly been killed following last weekend’s killing of about 16 soldiers and officers at Okuoma Community in Delta State. Naija News learnt that troops from the Nigerian Army invaded the Bayelsa community, opened fire at residents and razed three houses suspected to be the hideout of a militant leader allegedly involved in the killing of the military men on a rescue mission in Delta State.

item.title: 'Release Nnamdi Kanu To Me Before May 29'
item.description: Governor Charles Soludo of Anambra State has appealed to President Muhammadu Buhari to release the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, before he leaves office on May 29. The governor also urged President Buhari to release Kanu to him personally, adding that he could vouch that the IPOB leader would be presented in court when needed. Soludo made the appeal in a letter dated April 20, 2023, titled ‘Passionate Appeal For The Urgent Release Of Mazi’ and copied to the President-elect, Bola Tinubu, and the Minister of Justice and Attorney General of the Federation, Abubakar Malami.

item.description: Renowned method actor who won the Academy Award for Best Actor for Kramer vs. Kramer in 1979 and Rain Man in 1988. He had his breakthrough role as Benjamin Braddock in the 1967 classic The Graduate and also played leading roles in the films Midnight Cowboy, Tootsie and All the President's Men. Before Fame He began his acting career at the Pasadena Playhouse with his roommate and fellow actor Gene Hackman. He made his debut in the 1967 film The Tiger Makes Out.

item.title: Ha Sisters - Members, Ages, Trivia
item.description: Trio of sisters who took to social media to share their daily lives and adventures. They share content that highlights their lives as influencers and public figures. They have more than 290,000 followers on their shared Instagram account. Trivia In April of 2022, the sisters shared photos from their trip to Paris, France. They are also active on Emily Ha's YouTube channel. Their videos often include vlogs, such as 'get ready with me', as well as shopping hauls and fashion finds.

item.title: Inside Alyssa Raghu's American Idol Journey
item.description: Alyssa Raghu Nails 'American Idol' Audition for the Third Time — How Far Did She Previously Make It on The Show?Alyssa Raghu's 'American Idol' journey first started when she was 15 years old. Now, at age 21, she hopes things will be different. By Kelly CorbettUpdated March 20 2024, 12:21 p.m. ET Source: Disney/Eric McCandlessSo far, Season 22 of American Idol has been off to a great start with some amazing auditions, including ones from former NFL player Blake Proehl﻿ and Amy Ross Lopez's long-lost daughter, McKenna Breinholt.

item.title: NAF Neutralise Bandit Leader, Dogo Umaru, 40 Others
item.description: A bandit leader, Dogo Umaru on Wednesday was killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter aircraft. Umaru who was neutralised on Wednesday is one of the commanders loyal to wanted terrorist, Bello Turji. According to NAF, the airstrike killed at least 40 other bandits near Tsamben Babare village in Katsina. Umaru and his followers are responsible for attacks on Magama village in Jibia Local Government Area. The recent attack carried out by Umaru and his men was an invasion that led to the death of the Magama Divisional Police Officer and a soldier injured.

item.title: Sibadilishi msimamo wangu wa kumuunga mkono William Ruto 2022 - Aisha Jumwa
item.description: - Mbunge wa Malindi Aisha Jumwa amesema kwamba ameamua kumuunga mkono naibu rais William Ruto katika uchaguzi wa 2022 na hakuna mtu atakayemtishia - Hivyo basi, ametaka chama cha ODM kumuondoa kwenye kamati ya bunge kama kilivyodai -ODM imeapa kuwaadhibu viongozi wote wa mkoa wa Pwani ambao wametangaza kumuunga mkono Ruto katika uchaguzi mkuu ujao Mbunge wa Malindi Aisha Jumwa ametupilia mbali madai kwamba chama cha ODM kina mpango wa kumuondoa kwenye kamati ya bunge baada ya kutangaza kuwa atamuunga mkono naibu rais William Ruto katika uchaguzi mkuu wa 2022.

item.title: 2023: Why We Changed Presidential Primary, Others
item.description: The All Progressives Congress on Wednesday night revealed why it shifted the date of its presidential primary election. Naija News had earlier reported that the National Publicity Secretary of the party, Felix Morka, Wednesday, disclosed that the ruling party has shifted its presidential primary to May 29th, 2022. Morka in a statement released on Wednesday noted that the decision was reached by the National Working Committee (NWC) of the party.

item.title: Bianca Piazza - Distractify
item.description: Staff WriterLocation: New York City, New York, United StatesEducation: University at BuffaloContact us by Email Bianca Piazza is a film geek and New York-based writer who can't get enough of obscure horror movies, LGBTQ+ content, and really any indie flicks making noise on Twitter. When she’s not boring someone with her film knowledge, she’s likely boring someone with her 'RuPaul's Drag Race' knowledge. You can find her work in 'The Mary Sue,' 'Beyond Fashion Magazine,' and 'Film Daily,' to name a few publications.

item.title: Dan Greiner's biography: who is Lori Greiners husband?
item.description: Dan Greiner is known to many as Lori Greiner's husband. Lori is a television personality and entrepreneur. People recognise her as an investor on ABC's Shark Tank and the founder of For Your Ease Only, Inc. Dan is the Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the company. Unlike his wife, Dan Greiner leads a low-key life. He seldom makes media appearances. In fact, he is almost always behind the scenes.

Valerie Bertinelli - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Hot in Cleveland actress who won a Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress for playing Barbara Cooper Royer on the series One Day at a Time. Before Fame She studied acting at the Tami Lynn School of Artists. Trivia She played Gloria on the television series Touched by an Angel. Family Life She married Eddie Van Halen in 1981, and the couple had a son named Wolfgang in 1991. The couple later divorced, and in 2011 she married Tom Vitale.

item.title: 15 best Western movies of all time
item.description: Western movies are a genre of film which is centred on mainly the lives and culture that was in the America Old West during the later 19th century. The centre of attraction in these movies is usually a cowboy armed with the renowned revolver or a rifle wearing cowboy boots, bandannas, and buckskins. Movies in this list are gauged primarily on directing and writing brilliance, their individual popularity and also according to their ratings.

item.title: Aisha Abimbola son refutes claims of being mistreated by Lola Alao
item.description: - Social media was recently buzzing with the news that actress, Lola Alao, has been maltreating the kids of her late best friend and actress, Aisha Abimbola - Iyabo Ojo rose to Lola Alao’s defence saying that the children are well taken care of and she saw that when she travelled abroad and stayed with them for over a week - Aisha Abimbola’s son, Lase, has also addressed those saying he is being maltreated and he has denied the report in a video going round on social media

item.title: APC Postpones Re-run Primary Election In Nasarawa
item.description: The Nasarawa State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) has announced the postponement of its re-run primary election for the Nasarawa West Senatorial District. Naija News understands that the party had conducted its primary election on June 4, 2022, where Shehu Tukur emerged as the candidate for the West Senatorial District. His victory, however, was challenged in court by his contender at the primaries, Barr. Labaran Magaji. Magaji went to a Federal High Court in Lafia, the state capital, to seek the nullification of the result.

item.title: Audie Murphy - Trivia, Family, Bio
BOI To Disburse N200 Billion To Manufacturers, SMEs
item.description: To assist companies and manufacturers nationwide, the Bank of Industry (BOI) has announced that it will award three funding categories totalling N200 billion. A statement from the development bank mentioned that the money was from the FGN MSME Intervention Fund, the FGN Manufacturing Sector Fund, and the Presidential Conditional Grant Scheme. Naija News reports that the bank detailed that a N50 billion Presidential Conditional Grant Scheme is also available to help qualified owners of nano businesses.

item.title: Cross River police parade fake pastor for allegedly killing a baby (Photos)
item.description: - The Cross River state police command has paraded a pastor for allegedly killing a baby - Obo-Ekpenyog, the pastor of Royal God’s Commandment Ministry, Calabar, was arrested alongside six others A pastor identified as Tony Obo-Ekpeyong, has been paraded by the Cross River police command for allegedly being in possession of the heart of an 18-month-old baby girl whom he killed. Obo-Ekpenyog, the pastor of Royal God’s Commandment Ministry, Calabar, was arrested alongside six others on August 24.

item.title: Disgraced R&B Singer R. Kelly, Found Guilty Of Child Pornography And Abuse
item.description: Embattled US singer R.Kelly, was on Wednesday found guilty at his child pornography trial and abuse in Chicago. Naija News gathered that the singer was found guilty of coercing three minors into criminal sexual activity and producing three child sexual abuse videos. He is also serving a 30-year sentence after prosecutors proved that he ran a decade-long sex trafficking enterprise through his music business. The latest trial in Chicago focused on the sex tapes that were part of a 2008 Illinois child pornography trial in which Kelly was acquitted after the witness declined to take the stand.

item.title: Help us change lives, join Legit.ngs Patreon programme
item.description: A couple of years ago, Legit.ng started telling stories of people in Nigeria and through our readers’ support, we have impacted a number of lives together. But we believe the time has come for more lives to be changed and in our quest to ensure this happens, Legit.ng joined Patreon, a crowdfunding platform that enables fans (patrons) to pay and support content creators. item.title: How Much Does One Trip Of Buhari Cost
item.description: Since Muhammadu Buhari took office in May 29 he has travelled a lot. But how much does one trip of the president cost Nigeria? Sahara Reporters has made an investigation detailing the important financial cost of journeys undertaken by President Buhari and his team. Nigerians severely criticize the leader of the nation over his frequent trips, saying that there is so much work to do inside the country, due to a crushing fuel scarcity, continuous attacks by Boko Haram insurgents, and blackouts which demand immediate and focused attention.

item.title: How Nollywood Was Started With 419 Money - Alibaba
item.description: Veteran comedian, Alibaba has revealed a shocking in-depth details of how the Nigerian movie industry, Nollywood, was started with funds gotten fraudulently. The popular comedian in his question to President Jonathan during one of the many meetings, went viral on social media, leading to a lot of conversation. This is because no one has been more sensible and focused enough to open up on such a serious question. In an expose we got from Ynaija, the age-long comedian blew open some very comprehensive detail on Nollywood and the funding issues the industry is facing.

item.title: If a Big Brother Player Self-Evicts, Do They Go to Jury?
item.description: If a 'Big Brother' Houseguest Self Evicts, Do They Still Get to Go to Jury?By Allison DeGrushePublished Oct. 25 2023, 3:10 p.m. ET Source: CBSThe Gist: The Big Brother jury consists of a group of evicted houseguests.Each member of the jury lives the remainder of the game in sequester at the jury house.If a player makes it to the jury but self-evicts before they can head to the jury house, they are sent home.

item.title: Nigerias Oil Production Drops To New Low, As Price Averages $117.25
item.description: The Nigerian Upstream Petroleum Regulatory Commission (NUPRC), in its latest data released, disclosed that oil output dropped to an average of 1.24 million barrels per day (bpd) from 1.25 million in February 2022. According to the regulatory commission, the data released represents a 0.80 per cent decrease from the previous month, representing the lowest production capacity so far in the year. NUPRC disclosed that Nigeria is producing below 1.4 million barrels per day in 2022, failing to meet its Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) quota of about 1.

item.title: Ricky Gervais - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Co-writer, co-director and lead actor of the original British series The Office (UK) and Extras. He served as the controversial host of the Golden Globe Awards in 2010, 2011 and 2012, and he began playing the title character in the TV series Derek in 2012. He also plays Dr. McPhee in the Night at the Museum films. Before Fame He and Bill Macrae co-founded the New Wave pop duo Seona Dancing. Trivia He won his second Emmy and his seventh BAFTA in 2007 for his role on Extras.

item.title: Sabina Gadecki - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Model and actress signed by Ford Models who has worked with brands such as Jimmy Choo and Oil of Olay. Her film credits include Freaky Deaky and the Entourage movie. Before Fame At Fordham University, she studied international business and communications while also pursuing her modeling and acting career. Trivia She was previously the host of The World Poker Tour. Family Life She and her older brother were born to Polish parents.

item.title: Senator Owie Speaks On Zoning Presidential Ticket In PDP
item.description: The former Chief Whip of the Senate, Roland Owie, has called on the leadership of the Peoples Democratic Party to zone its presidential ticket to the North ahead of the 2023 general election. Owie while addressing newsmen in Benin, Edo State, noted that the South has ruled Nigeria for 14 years under PDP, while the north has ruled for two years. He said, “PDP is the only party that believes in the unity of this country, the presidency should go to the North.

By Allison DeGrusheUpdated July 11 2024, 1:43 p.m. ET Source: ABCFollowing the shocking news of Golden Bachelor couple Gerry Turner and Theresa Nist's split, ABC is here to mend our broken hearts. In May 2024, the network finally announced the leading lady for the highly-anticipated spinoff series, The Golden Bachelorette.

item.title: Why Did Spotify Remove the Heart and Replace It?
item.description: In February of 2023, Spotify announced that it would be removing its heart button, leaving many users to wonder why it had made that decision. The Gist: Spotify removed its heart button and replaced it with a plus, which allows you to add songs to multiple playlists at the same time. Spotify maintains that this is an improvement to the user experience on the app. The change first started rolling out in the early months of 2023, and has left some users confused.

item.title: Zulum Leads Kinsmen to Bury 43 Farmers Killed by Boko Haram
item.description: Governor of Borno State, Professor Babagana Umara Zulum on Sunday,  led the kinsmen and other residents, still in shock, for the funeral of 43 farmers slaughtered by the Boko Haram insurgents. Though the victims lived in Zabarmari, a farming community in Jere Local Government Area, famous for rice cultivation and local processing, they were attacked on Saturday, at Koshebe village, a place in Mafa Local Government Area. Zulum, during his visit, was told that the death toll was yet to be fully ascertained.
